9s_btjcDqwICYWu_I5-5SA.text: On vacation for the week in Vegas. Wanted something besides strip food.....!!!the hubby likes Greek so I found this place here! Great food, I had the gyro plate, he had the gyro, also had the lemon chicken rice soup, yum! Meat was moist and flavorful. Everything looked good! We got the baklava to go. Thanks!

_ZGSA6uKpaZu4ZSWexjX6w.text: Started the day off by doing some charity work for kids!! Those of you that do that sort of thing know how much of an appetite it can work up! So we wanted to follow up with some good quality food. That's exactly what this restaurant offers! The Gyro and Fries were especially satisfying. Filled with meat and flavorful toppings, this was obviously the way to go. The fries that go along with it could be a dish that you could have by itself. It had unique herbs and spices to send your taste buds rolling. The pita bread at this place is just unreal, so soft and warm, it just compliments the food so well.   The service was amazing. They treated all of their customers like family. It's definitely one of those places where they remember their frequent customers.   My experience here was absolutely exquusite, can't wait to come back ^^ !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Best in vegas!

oHNQEIjYhGoTB-V8UiJurQ.text: The best Greek food in Las Vegas  The owner is very nice I love the place I could eat here every day

JH5bRAz3k8BvkMU--vNqVA.text: Found this place on Christmas Eve since every place we originally planned on eating closed shortly after lunch. My boyfriend and I were pleased we stumbled upon this Greek Bistro since we acquired a taste for Greek back in Reno. We were quite sad we'd be leaving the family owned place since we ate there often, but were hopeful when we enjoyed the dishes here. This will definitely be our go to when we get a craving. We tried the falafel appetizer, delicious, and the keftedakia kabob, also delicious! The service was also a pleasant experience. Can't wait to go back and try their Gyro.

ZjgwUlI8mKSpmr6X1r91gg.text: I'm just going to say WOW! This place is so good you must try it. I had the chicken gyro and my wife had the traditional gyro and both were out of this world. I'm coming back ALOT!

RB4F7Z7CH9zTyaNQuO4TFQ.text: Today I went here with some friends that were visiting from out of town for lunch and I was very impressed with this place. The food was really good than I expected. I don't go out for Greek Food often but I will definitely be coming back as many times as possible. The gyro sandwiches and fries were to die for!

QEyp1s1ylnteMaOnTgnurA.text: Hey Family!! I absolutelyyyyy looooove this bistro!! The food is so fresh and clean, the building is always tidy, and the customer service is top notch!! They know my order by heart.  Living in Texas and San Diego for the Navy... This is the best Greek I have ever had. Indulge!!

m9kTXRHpRsW7PUJT4ov2iA.text: Good good food, good portion for the price paid, clean bathroom and restaurant.  Good customer service!

xAOehnCamk0io877o5B9Pg.text: Cute little neighborhood Greek restaurant! Nothing pretentious ......you go to the counter order your food it's  cooked delicious and served to table ,fresh with reasonable prices. The staff are well versed in the menu and offer recommendations perfectly. Tasty quick and affordable. Worth the wait for a table!

7z1AQABWLFADcUNjLHnpkQ.text: Once our ordered was taken it was 45 minutes before we received our food we didn't order anything elaborate just two gyros with fries. Service was not great our drink glasses were empty 5to 10 minutes before they were refilled...The food is very good but definitely not worth the wait. probably will not return

wphXiPUjYg_064eJ1IRqcA.text: I was not really a fan of Greek food, especially tzatziki, before I found this gem, so I ordered the chicken gyro and asked for tzatziki on the side.  By itself the gyro stood out as being the best I have ever had and the tzatziki put it over the top.  The fries where really flavorful as well.    I also tried their lemon soup and that had a great taste to it and i will definitely order it again.  Oh and the baklava is amazing as well!  My parents ordered the gyro salad which we both agree was sensational.  We are originally from Chicago which has a huge Greek community and my mom said it was the best Greek food she has tried outside of Chicago.  it has never let me down and is the only great place I will go to in town for Greek.  The family that owns this restaurant are all extremely nice people and it shows when you walk in the door with their warm welcome and smiling faces.

LIYsRYqyoKuxnYFaReHxHA.text: I was so happy to find a place worth a 5 star rating.  This little place has the best Gyro I've ever had. We had to order more than we could eat so we could try quite a few things. We ordered traditional and chicken gyros, order of hummus and an order of fries....all excellent! I'll be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

0MFmIIa_L9QHpSOqiwjdXQ.text: Very friendly people, service was excellent and the food was amazing! I ordered the Gyro Traditional, it had a lot of meat and the pita was soft. I will definitely come back again. The best Gyro in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro Traditional

dSY9VHahan23-gCMpOsfpA.text: I thought I'd switch it up from my usual Greek place down the way and try the Greek Bistro out since Yelpers seem to love this place. Yeah, the reviews did not mislead!! I tried the Gyro salad  and I loved it! It comes with a house made, olive oil-based dressing that really makes the salad! I'm not a fan of olives so I got the salad without. The lettuce (romaine) was fresh and crisp. The gyro meat (and there was plenty of it!) was tender and flavorful. Salad also came with feta cheese, red onion, tomato, cucumber and a wonderful tzakai sauce. Salad and soda came out to $13.00. I will return when I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. This was one heck of a tasty salad!!

82kx7JwR6vARC8snrEiNAQ.text: Potentially the best Greek food I've ever had, with also the nicest staff! Family owned and very good service, and the food was worth every penny.   We both ordered the TRADITIONAL GYRO, which was so delicious, had lots of meat that was juicy as well as flavorful! The fries were also really good!   The baklava was a great way to end the meal too. Wish they would open a location on the north side... worth the drive for Greek food fix though! :)

NxN1AIV5S-bk4nBtOxTfEw.text: I love the Greek Bistro, I've been coming here since it opened and I've never had a bad meal, everything is always fresh and delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken plate with double salad

EziMYuUhOFgUKtJQpwBHQw.text: We came in for the first time today at about 2:30 on a Saturday. The place was empty. By 3:00, almost every table was taken, which seemed strange. My wife and I enjoyed the chicken souvlaki which came with a salad first. The salad was very good. Then came the grilled chicken which looked to be marinated in a sauce similar in color and taste to our salad dressing, with onions and grilled tomatoes, and we opted for the rice pilaf. A small plastic tub came on the side with tzatziki sauce, which was maybe the best I've ever had in my life. The owner came over to pick up my plate and I remarked how great the food was and that the True mark of great Greek food for me is the tzatziki sauce. Her response was, "We have the best tzatziki sauce in the world!" I'm coming back to try the lamb and I'm getting extra tzatziki!!!

hu8G1BEkplCWF--jLGno5g.text: My husband and I came into town tonight for Tough Mudder. We live in a small town with limited options for restaurants. Driving to our hotel, eye spyed Greek Bistro. We stopped in for dinner. Walking into the restaurant, we were greated with a smiling young man and his beautiful mother. The customer service was outstanding. The Dolmades, the falafel sandwich, and the Mythology beer was so delicious. My husband had the shrimp on top of delicious rice. The pita was fresh and delicious. The young man checked on us a few times during our meal. We still have half of our food leftover in the mini fridge. We ordered baklava to go(no room for anything else!) if we ever come back to Henderson, we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. The beer was good!

m5_oR0E4hGx7vTedwQAwrQ.text: Love this family owned bistro. Best Greek food in Vegas. Trust me when I say it won't disappoint.

W7ccFEPICss7T7zHQvoI9Q.text: Love this little place. Owners are awesome and the food is the best Greek in my area.   If you are around the Galleria Mall/Sunset station, definitely try them!!!   the Pasticio is soooooooo creamy delicious.

eVwD0MdWFNUYcZUL74qKMA.text: This is by far the best Greek I've had. Our family visits here often. My wife is vegetarian and loves the spanakopita. It is really big and she loves it! I get the gyro with fries. Both are so flavorful. The fries have homemade spices on top. This appears to be own by a family. The mom is always in the kitchen cooking and the children help with seating and orders. We've done sit down and take out. Both are great!

O370WqQEg5s4imPUuncu5Q.text: We decided to try this place because of the positive Yelp reviews. I can honestly say that we were not disappointed in the least! It's in a little strip mall, which is scary at first but once you sit down, you will feel right at home! The service is excellent and the gyro is probably the best I have ever had! They serve a lemon potato with the gyro plate that everyone has to try. Before you leave, don't forget to save room for the baklava dizzled with honey!

VW_4vzlqnRCcRREUJdovSA.text: Like others said, this is a great family owned business. The food was really good, and there is a lot of it! We started shared the greek salad which was a great appetizer for 2 people. I had the traditional gyro and my wife had the chicken gyro, both with fries. It was too much food for 2 people, neither of us finished all of the fries. We had a $25 restaurant.com certificate which stated we had to spend at least $37.50, which is why we ordered so much food. We ordered beer and wine also so we did hit the minimum we had to spend. At first the older female owner (the same in previous reviews) took the coupon and said it didn't apply to the beverages. But I showed her in the description that is doesn't state that, just that we had to spend $37.50. She went to the back and after a few minutes came back and said ok, but didn't seem too thrilled about it. She was still very nice though and seemed to appreciate our business. The traditional gyro is the best! My wife and I agreed that it was better than the chicken. And the pita bread is delicous. The greek salad was really good and so were the fries. If you're looking for a great gyro this place is a must. We will definitely go back in the future (and order less food).

D36HXXB5ZJsfgLGmSJnHWQ.text: This is the second time I have been to the Greek Bistro. Last time, I had the falafel wrap and greek fries. My Mom had a gyro salad. In addition, we got baklava and hummus to go. Both of us loved our food. The wraps/pita are so good. I went back tonight and got the chicken gyro and greek fries. It was just as yummy and good as last time. This is definitely my favorite greek restaurant in the area. I am definitely planning on going back again

xPr7VyY3UYeiGusVt8jelw.text: This restaurant has the best Mediterranean food I ever tasted. The chicken salad is so good and packed with flavor. I recommend this restaurant to people.

dok1CubKPiYccx2CZt_jSA.text: The food is very good. My only complaint is I ordered a chicken kabob ala carte... What I recieved was three small pieces of chicken in a box.... I am pretty sure when ordering a kabab meal you get more than three pieces of chicken.

8FypigykbY1cOB5anCLyzQ.text: It isn't often that I take the time to write a review particularly for a food establishment but I almost feel compelled to do so regarding Greek Bistro. A sign advertising the gyro special caught my eye and I figured I give it a whirl for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised. I was greeted warmly by the staff and the food not only met but exceeded my expectations. The fries were rightly seasoned and the quality of the meat was superb. The restaurant will definitely be seeing more of me.

misLy6j3l8vUilnOolIwpw.text: Seriously amazing and hands-down the best greek restaurant around.

-gg5tTafYy9NfGHPMrb-Xw.text: I came to this place looking for some good Greek but ended up finding the best koobideh/ground beef kabob in Vegas. Skip the expensive and always disappointing Persian restaurants. This is one of the best kabobs I've had and that's saying a lot since I'm Middle Eastern. Two huge kabobs and rice for only $13!! Cannot be beat.

LI7dWkTkrAWhhAuWApuSDQ.text: WOW!  Got the gyro salad and it was amazing!! Nice little family owned restaurant.

IzI1JCpJ0t3g_Pg_OGVb5g.text: I go here weekly now, especially like the seasoned fries and the gyro. The rice pudding is very good also. The people who run this place are very friendly to the customers and provide great service everyone helps out. The only downside to this place would be the location, it is hard to find. Once you find it though you will be going back like I do I bet.

TAHx_Aeh2zuPIoyKhhjbYg.text: Best Greek food I've had in the Las Vegas area. Hard to find, but worth the search. Sits just behind the Wildfire casino in the the Sunset Station parking lot. Let's keep these mom and pop gems in business.

gH9YZZFoi01rxXc7b9mkXQ.text: Really good gyro! THe overall lunch had character with a more personal season.

0U84LVH87qVYWWEbP7AD-A.text: the Kabob was so awsome and tasty...very clean and nice place..the employees also very friendly and professional...i love greek food,this one of the best i ever have....

r226wNBYnf9F3cqWvCu7sQ.text: I love this place! It's consistently good. I feel good every time after my lunch. I always get the chicken gyro but my wife will get other things off the menu and never had had a complaint. So leave the comfort of Sunset Station and wonder over for some fresh Greek.

sXc7_VlwOvHlLy9oJhrEHw.text: Very good food. Beautiful presentation. Family-owned with pride and care. Clean visible kitchen area. Clean dining area and bathroom too. Only caution would be if mildly spicy red peppers are not your thing, just let them know to go easy when you order. They are very accommodating. The chicken soup and Greek salad could easily be a whole lunch meal or even dinner for a light eater. Although they don't prepare the pita dough, they do bake it on the premises. We were again very pleased with our experience. We try to eat here whenever we come to Vegas.

YWf1sKCvU3hPKsLqE7UvgA.text: The gyro is phenomenal, service is great. Good luck finding a better gyro in this town!!!! Oh and the fries are unreal!

9msDxhRYSKzNTYGTEEr6rA.text: This place has been my gyro staple for that last decade.  I went on a gyro walk about a few years ago and ate a gyro at virtually every gyro spot in the valley (off the strip obviously) and this place easily finishes towards the top.  Consistently good and locally owned, what more can you ask for?

ITicKHDoeZt_QfRaU1f30A.text: The food here is really great. It isn't really fancy, but who needs fancy. It is nice, clean, and casual. Everything is fresh and made onsite and they even have Greek beer.  We will be back....soon

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States

k8ABkmu6sZ5uaVNMRJG1OA.text: Had a terrific gyro and fries - also comes with a super fresh and tasty greek side salad --  wow.  Seriously delicous.  Wonderfully fresh.    Service started out with a bit of attitude considering the joint was empty -- and we were a little skeptical when he said the gyro was the best in town -- but ya know, I think it was.  I've not tried all of them  yet, but it's not a bad aspiration if I were in serious need of weight gain (which sadly, I'm not) so I'll have to consider it a treat and good to know about in that wasteland of nothingness food-wise...  If you're really in the mood to splurge, they have plenty of Greek dessert options, or you can get frozen custard at Neilson's next door who's stopped making sandwiches, probably because the Greek Bistro's are too good to compete with...    ahhh summer....

4rdT6NB6vhtS9Fekj7OVKQ.text: So glad we came! Great food, fantastic service! The fries were such a yummy surprise! Hubby had the traditional gyro, me and my little shared the garlic shrimp with almond raisin rice. DELICIOUS!

N-nsON4R3ZMTpLoIE1NqYQ.text: You can't go wrong here. Just passing through Vegas and hit this place for lunch and it hit the spot.

jbRsZe7QH2qcLWbT3qd7ag.text: Went to the Greek Bistro for the first time today after seeing Spider-Man with my buddy Steve. He's been talking up this place. I see why. The service was friendly and the food was fantastic. Everything was so fresh and delicious. Had the lamb Gyro with seasoned fries and I have to say one of the best I've had in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro with fries

ZALIUoL2I3UcRg6qBRW6tA.text: I always order my food to go, to feed 3/4 people in my family just under 20 minutes waiting period, I watch the tv meanwhile  and Keep going back for good food!!

KmM01mvZnqYydWeqmyLDgw.text: Food was fresh, delicious, and unique. And plentiful.  Reminds me of my mom's cooking.  Flavors were just right -- and not too overpowering.  Hope to come back and try more dishes.

jsZoMwjkPpig1H-5DoZCeA.text: Yum! I'm an instant fan. Now I know of two awesome Greek restaurants near my house.  If you are dining in there are tables for sit down service. Take-out is either called in ahead ordered at the register in the back. We were doing take-out yesterday.   Someone greeted us soon after coming in and asked if wanted to dine in or take-out. We grabbed a menu at the back counter, picked out our dishes, and ordered. Food pricing was reasonable and our food was ready to go in less than 10 minutes. It seemed like a friendly family run restaurant.  I ordered the Shrimp a la Greek. The sauce on the shrimp was good and I absolutely loved the bed of rice. The rice had almonds, spinach, fruit, and plenty of seasoning. It was one of the most addictive rices I've ever had. There was a nice amount of salad and the dressing was really good. The dressing was different than other Greek dressings I've had, but in a good way. The pita was really soft and nicely seasoned. I was definitely impressed with each part of this meal.  My husband had the Greek Plate which came with gyro meat, Greek potatoes, pita, and salad. He loved this meal. I sampled the Greek potatoes and thought they were well seasoned and delicious. We also had the Baklava, but that wasn't my favorite. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best I've had.  Greek Bistro is definitely one of my local favorites now. Yummy with great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Baklava
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro Plate
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp a la Greek

noxYm-R5TJyjPPVAf6rDSw.text: By the beard of Zeus this place is so good it should be made into a temple. A place for worship of the powerful Greek food. Always great service, always great food, I love it I love it and so will you! Give it a go! Run over here and don't fall, trip and dodge the incoming wrench! You'll fall in love!

lMDHhnkNoTtidU3RjkP9_g.text: Hands down the most authentic am great tasting gyro I have had amazing flavor down the fries , everything is literally so good!! I highly recommend this place. I'm a good guy I have excellent taste I promise you, YOU CAN TAKE MY WORD, TRUST IN MY REVIEWS.. the salads are amazing the grape leaf rolls are great the pita the tiziki everything is so good and i enjoyed the Greek ambiance the restaurant has to offer. MUST HAVE IF YOUR IN HENDERSON. If not it's worth the drive...

Good service and they even had the hockey playoffs on I'll definitely come here again

CF--OBJPapyCdE7M5zplvA.text: Where ever else you go, you will end up coming back here because it's the best Greek food in town! Nice ambience, nice people, fast service and delicious flavorful food!!! The rice is cooked to perfection and the gyros are amazing. We love this place, we can't just stay away!!!

b2iChiZQ6KHosCiYndgnHw.text: Very delicious food, nice casual atmosphere. Have the lamb when you come here with the tzadziki and pita. Everything on the menu seemed delicious. Wish there was one close to where I lived...

7QSPvtqidwY9XLXhZgU7Xw.text: This place is always a win! I don't understand how this place isn't slammed busy, but I'm glad because it's delicious. I'm not usually a chicken gyro guy, but theirs are great.

9pG_daptBALjsIfcTWnzcg.text: Amazing food... great staff.... will be making this a regular stop. The falaffal balls were the best we have ever had. The gyro and fries was alot to eat, very generous portions.

iTWLr3V9yvOOgr6hbjLClQ.text: This is our go to Greek spot.  Hubby always gets the traditional gyro with feta fries.  I go back and forth from a gyro or falafel.  I usually add on their hummus or tzatziki with pita chips and bread.  Love that they give you both.  Their Spanakopita is another one of my favorites.  I've never had a bad meal here.  Service hasn't been a issue.  We live close so we almost always get it to go.  We are lucky to have several good Greek restaurants in the area.  Even with those we always find ourselves back here.

4FrYDuhGnv4J8YbttCUuFA.text: What a good Hidden Gem excellent food great original flavors a must-try ! Loved the Shrimp ala Greek & of course had to have the Gyro, it was amazing. Will definitely be back to try more!

Massive photos adorn the walls so you feel the lush of the ever so blue water and instantly recognize able architecture. Food is authentic and tasty and we did the usual. Hummus app, you get pita bread and chips, score. I had a gyro and my girl a Greek salad add chicken, I know, we always do that so creatures of habit we are. We are not regulars yet but it will happen, soon .

TNIhCJh2iPBn6DKGTCHH0g.text: Authentic delicious Greek Food . I try to come here as much as possible . I always order gyro salad well done and it is always cooked to perfection . Seasoned fries love them . Hummus is excellent along with their other sauces . Finding authentic traditional food is hard but this place is spot on . Service is also excellent .

nyhNAFGNAuhvgqg4AdKQwQ.text: A group of us went here on our lunch break. There were quite a number of empty tables. We all got the same stuff: gyro with fries. I also placed a to-go order for another co-worker with our dine-in order. The server asked, "do you want it immediately?" Well, yes, that's the whole point of ordering it with everything else.  The food was great. The pita was warm, fresh and soft. The fries were tasty and crunchy. But where's my to-go order?  We had to follow-up many times with 3 different people. "I didn't think you wanted it now." WTH??? No apologies whatsoever. We were very late for our meeting and a co-worker starved to death. Don't go here on your lunch break!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional Gyro with fries

NCUzeMixYixlb6ShUQS5uA.text: Christmas Eve Lunch for work I ordered the Lamb Shank plate. It was my second time ordering it super yummy and one of the best Lamb I have ever had!! We are pretty much hooked here. If you want some real Greek food this is the place to go!!

zI5GXLOEdi6ap6pmRXucdw.text: Their French fries are amazing. You can never go wrong ordering their gyros. So delicious and quick. Great service all around.

pJepOcu7oObvJZHDw7NkXg.text: My boyfriend and I enjoy coming here frequently. The staff are all very friendly and the food is awesome

4r3d_ayUZpNqFsp3Uyi-NQ.text: The food here is amazing.  I have been going here for two years now.  The Greek soup is super good. Their salads are fresh.  The Gyros are also delicious and not greasy.  The restaurant is smaller in size so at lunch time they are packed but make every effort to get tables busted and people seated as quickly as possible. This is my go to Greek food restaurant.

UY9ZGsOeeoJ_J7zIUGT2Yg.text: Oh my gosh! Best lamb shank ever! My experience of this meal is the polar opposite of that of the lamb itself. Actually, the lamb's ghost should feel honored by how good a dish was made of it.

Wha9SxRyVPL4MH438nNcAQ.text: Deliciousness and authentic! Service was fantastic. We had baba ganoush, dolmas, and chicken plate .! Best greek place in town, don't let the location fool you!

oe7wyiLux1omiOZRgKD5xQ.text: This place is awesome. Everytime I eat there the food is perfect. They are always polite, fast service, great food. The baklava is AWESOME! The gyro...perfect. This family place is becoming a regular spot for me. I highly recommended it.

9hoiznBZlhp3n4-DAo8RWg.text: So delicious... The hummus and pita..omg the rice!!  Lemon potatoes and Filet.  All so tasty. And the owner( I assume) was very sweet too. Thanks well be back!!

FhRlZtvC8u7wkBFZBO786g.text: We both had the Greek lasagna huge portions and fresh out of the oven. Salads were good too. First time there and it was pretty empty at 5 pm on a Friday night. Beers were only a reasonable $2.50 and $3.50. A bottle of decent wine about $20. I opted for the ice tea but no lemon. Returned and wife had chicken kabobs looked yummy. I stuck with the Greek lasagna huge.

GQzantHtsYKhktCupdOOvA.text: This place is hands down THE best Greek food in Vegas! I keep coming back! The gyros sandwiches are the best I've had. Pita is super soft, meat is tender and flavorful, nothing dried out (my pet peeve). The gyros salad is huge! Tons of meat in it. Order with dressing and sauce on the side, it's better that way. The baklava? Fantastic. Everything we order always is super fresh! And the service is great. You won't be disappointed!

GLjNK8a7RCQy5pTOA7UuOw.text: Finally, a decent spot in Henderson!  Greek lasagna - rich and creamy, good to share Gyro - pretty good but next time I'll probably try another dish

Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States

E4O_IYWUV7SyvxAfk-I1pQ.text: This is the first place my wife and I went to when we first arrived in Vegas, we went as a recommendation from our real estate agent. We now take our friends and family here whenever they come into town because it is the best Greek food we have ever tasted. The pita bread is the best, so fresh and so tasty! The gyros are fantastic, and my coworkers rave about the lasagna! The service is always prompt and courteous, just a great local place to visit if you're in the Henderson area! Oh and don't forget to get the hummus and pita ..... YUMMMMMMM!!!!

JygA3Pp8VOjEkmrfqGJ0ng.text: Started with the Hummus. It was amazing! Some of the best hummus I've ever had! Ate all of it. Then I had the Traditional Gyro with Greek fries. Delicious! Boyfriend had the Gyro Plate and he loved it. Great place, great food. We will definitely be going back soon!

jDdLMOc_yQdwJvH9zJlXbQ.text: Years ago I used to go to this place all the time, but when I moved a bit away I just didn't come as often as before.    But on Saturday I was at the mall so I made a point to come in and try it and see if it was as good as I remembered.  It was!  I ordered the gyro and fries, easy seasoning on the fries.  I got my food in a timely manner and the server was very attentive, making sure my glass was never empty.  When I got my food I took my first bite and kicked myself for staying away so long.  The pita was warm and soft, the meat seasoned perfectly and warmed up just right, the edges had just a bit of crisp and the sauce - as always Yum!  And there was so much food I had to take half of my sandwich and fries home.  I will NOT be waiting years to go back to this amazing place!

_zKLVhcIb2CiAAkdqCY9hg.text: I've eaten there twice while visiting Vegas. The food was excellent as was the service.  I strongly recommend it.

yxcQzR2_NhtMQ2DBi9YvDQ.text: Gyro only had two pieces of meat.. chicken plate only had about six pieces of meat for $13? Garlic sauce tasted like sour cream, we will not be back. Rip off for sure don't even bother trying go to the 'The Great Greek' instead

se7vbNHLbcE1ybkggeGhDg.text: My wife and I come here much too infrequently for a quick lunch. Today we both had the chicken souvlaki with lemon potatoes. As is typically the case, the food was outstanding. The chicken was tender and flavorful. Not sure what they do to the vegetables that are on the skewer but they're always so sweet. This is also the only restaurant that I actually eat all the potatoes. The waitstaff are always attentive. The owner is always around and she make sure everything is perfect.

i1j1TZ4kBQLObQKyRMSsbw.text: This food is very amazing. It is packed with so much flavor. The Greek gyro is so good and it goes good with the Greek fries.

AzFIY1LDd4j8tfBJhMMVaw.text: Very friendly and unassuming. Great food. Not fancy but great food.  They just want you to be happy. Give it a spin you won't be disappointed.

0KgCnCh05Wzyfs1XcX_E2w.text: Had dinner here recently. As always, food and service were great. Had lamb shank, heaven!

fvpxdVACLIA0B2ktmgz6OQ.text: This is my favorite Greek place in all of Vegas and Henderson. Incredible gyros, fries, tzitziki, and pita. Fantastic service - the owners are kind folks. It's a great value too.   If I lived closer, it'd be hard not to go every week.

PN4UpkP-U8MOajWr8YJpdg.text: Huge portions...I had the gyro with a side salad and could only make it halfway through...but it was really tasty!  Friendly people, cute ambience...my one complaint was that I ordered a glass of Pinot and they served me merlot.  But it was a large serving and I wasn't at a nice steakhouse or anything, so I didn't complain!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro and side salad

PfA3QXYlK3tljeJw87l4XA.text: Some of the most delicious food I have EVER had! I am so glad we took the chance to check this place out this past weekend while in Vegas. I will definitely make it a point to come back here during my yearly trips to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. My amazing traditional gyro &amp; fries.

SnS6aYTKM4lQB7a6fYObWw.text: Best hummus I have ever had. Great family run restaurant. Food was like being in Greece.

gZ4nJYoz2QXWCHh6R2bkKw.text: Mmmmmm baklavaaaaa, sorry got ahead of myself!  We were out and about in Henderson and I remebered reading yelp reviews of the Greek Bistro. So we decided to do late lunch. Great customer service, good ice tea! Lol always important! We had....  Spanikopita: it was good, not great, but good. Salad was fabulous! Watch for pits in olives. A great salad dressing, one that i have never had before.   Gyro: very good tender meat and the tzatziki and fries holy cow so great!   And the baklavaaaa, yes you have to sing it, was out of this world, straight out of the oven! Best honey I have ever had light and crunchy. When he put it on the table it screamed TADA!  Overall a great light cool meal on a hot day! We will be back....

oFBv1ZKS_MbgH9zaVK608Q.text: Absolutely am never disappointed at any meal here.  One of my favorites, family owned and run with great food and though small , very friendly atmosphere.  Lamb shank is superb as is pistachio.  Desserts fantastic.  Just tried new one I highly recommend, numoorah! Try it!

J4Afd3VGhbnpwL0JTyAENQ.text: Best Greek place in town. Great service. Amazing food! Don't normally come out of my comfort zone but I'm soooo glad I did ! I will be coming back !

JJyU_rndeySL4rRgHrhgVg.text: Best place for your greek fix!!! Food is always amazing!!! Fast friendly service! YUM!!!!

tWGG8WeQUOZpWnb1l80h7A.text: Excellent food! Great family run feel. Hidden gem. Traditional gyro was great! Yummy hummus! Excellent rice pudding... Baklava was good.. Not great! Overall excellent experience though!

1251PfOgApjIBKewFHMR6A.text: Had the traditional Gyro with salad. It was exceptional. I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Plus Desert

k9huoyH4PHqZBiXJ003Byg.text: Open kitchen layout. Authentic. Clean. Super family feel and friendly service. Offered me extra meat if I was still hungry!  Good ice tea refills. Very pleasing

lct9VODcBUfBr2x4PBCjtQ.text: Personable and friendly service. Walked in and placed a take out order. Nice people at the counter. Smelled good. Not too long of a wait at all for a walk in. Alexandrian vegetable vegetarian meal was delicious. Roasted veggies in phyllo dough. Mousaka was good tasting but just a little greasy on the bottom. Will go back again to try something different and a dessert.

CIZSrPR0bMNnuaGw_EmtMw.text: Excellent local find. Service was excellent along with the food. Falafel gyro and the traditional gyro were outstanding, and their rice pudding desert is by far the best rice pudding I've ever had. Being a lover of Greek food, as well as having traveled to Greece, this is easily some of the best Greek food I've had.

G8G7UerXmWt7Wm-LiyTKwA.text: I ate here last week and loved.  LOVE supporting locally owned businesses and these guys really seem to care about quality and service.  Will definitely be back.

34T2MCgRsUbgPghHlQ1e0Q.text: What a great little place. Fantastic food and awesome service. Winning combo!

8EbuDujQ3Fe_861xniynzA.text: I have been coming here for years. The food and service are always amazing. They always make me feel like a welcomed guest in their home. It's refreshing to find a quality, family owned business in Vegas. I highly recommend!

5b2SGQyesmGDuPt2ZWaevQ.text: Yum, yelp you didn't fail me here. We have been a fe times and it is great! We have gone here a few times, and everything is great. We drove 10 miles out of the way and didn't have a free steak lunch just to eat here. I have seen stuff staying it is expensive, but for what you get in quality and service it is worth it. I had a glass of wine a gyros on the last visit and it was just 25.00 with a healthy tip. I love small family places and this doesn't disappoint, all fresh all good. I saw someone have the lamb shank and next time that is what we will get.   Cheers!

MFEP1jMzgN-uH4qNNmSVFw.text: This restaurant is SO good!!! When We walked in around 5pm, the restaurant was empty except for one person waiting for their call in order. I was a little hesitant at first...  I ordered the gyro plate. The pita bread tasted amazing, the meat was so flavorful, the tzatziki was delicious and the lemon potatoes were perfect.  My boyfriend ordered a shrimp and rice plate that was amazing!  The side salad that comes with the meal is really yummy too, lots of feta and great house dressing.  The two owners were there tonight too, such a sweet couple. The lady was our server, her hospitality and friendliness was outstanding.  This is a great restaurant that I will recommend to everyone. Go here! The food is so delicious.  By the time we left around 6pm the restaurant had really started to fill up. I will definitely be going back!

vPn_ta-pPhwaKUUdZDJy9A.text: I don't know how this place gets so many stars, food is cold and service is extremely bad

AzNGD4D64NWx2aCTiXDq2w.text: One of the only local spots or food spots that I've rated a perfect 5 stars! Yes I'm pretty picky and have strict standards with how I rate food quality, taste, ambiance, and most importantly service. I may not be Greek, but I wished I knew someone who was to show me a better spot than this joint. Actually, not really. This place is the spot I bring friends, coworkers, and family to when they want real good home cooked Greek food. Best tasting big & juicy chicken gyros and awesome seasoned fries with yummy tzatziki sauce! From their hummus, to the other dishes I dare try not to misspell...this place is a must dine! Friendly service and reasonably priced. Only locals know where the best Greek food is in town.

8IKmY939lZcSNrkloMyQQg.text: So as many of you knw me i have been working with many restaurants/ lounges and i have tried many food at many places.... as you knw everything i write a review about is fully 100% base on my experience and full knowledge!  And here i am at greek bistro , the best quality meat  , the spices , the taste and the way they cook their food here is beyond delicious! Also everything here is 100% fresh ! Kosher ! And Halal! They do lots of catering so great option if you have a party! They can make anything happen and you will be 100% happy with the result! Also i work with them so if u need help with coordinating foods for your parties just ask me !

w_uWI7-weF3DQKLSkn8GTA.text: Great place !great food !great customer service !5 start for sure and i will be back! We also ordered bunch of dishes to go for our next few days!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. The place is amazing ! Great quality food! Great customer service! 5 stars for sure!!!

XsL50QLHzJfaJRbvpRXxaA.text: Ran in for a quick take out order., so didn't sample too much.  The dining area was very busy for 5:00 at a retail-casual location so I had high hopes.  I wasn't disappointed.    Very traditional Greek menu.  The pastichio was outstanding and was enough for me for 2 meals.  The gryo salad was also spectacular and upon request they kept the meat separate so my salad didn't warm on the ride home.  Good prices, great service and outstanding Greek fare.   Now they need a fancy location with a bar so I can bring my wife on our anniversary.

UdvhZ5l8kFI0urY5Vz27lQ.text: Been here twice now for their  classic gy r os. They ste amongst the best i have had. I highly recommend y hem and the seasoned fries.

UiXS2cVc8hAzSX3cftFn5A.text: Great food , it was so delicious Every thing about the place is great  The price is pretty good and quality is good.  Nice full menu also if you looking at treating a friend or a colleague.

Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Best Traditional Gyro Sandwich ever tried in Vegas

hq_XCCIWTcw0jFtBwvAblQ.text: Made our way around town and ended up here at the Greek Bistro.  What a great decision that was!!  Service was very good and the young woman helping us answered all our questions about the menu items.  This is now on my dining hotspot radar.  Had the original Gyro.  Salad & Fries on the side.  Good-good.   Highlight was the Rice pudding for sure!  Zeus would be proud!  As for me, just want to give an honest review to all of you and stay away from Hades..  LOL

wkdcKriCzRfhFwzjeXo27w.text: Restaurant was clean, chicken gyros were flavorful, and service was decent. Waitress forgot to bring out humus  appetizer before entrees.

yCrRWmgtTbSYVggymNeMNA.text: Seriously the best salad. With so much competition within 5-7 mins of this tiny place it shines pretty bright. Flavors are stellar and everything tastes very fresh and vibrant. Obviously this isn't the first location but it's nice to see the same standards are carried out. Good job guys!

ETj2QW1Xs5O0NtWpTY7CHA.text: We wanted to try authentic greek food.  My daughter searched and saw the reviews. We ordered, Filet Mignon plate,  Gyro sandwich, chicken skewers and of course pita with hummus. The Filet Mignon is a must have, the meat so tender and flavorful. The gyro sandwich was very tasty. The best part was dessert, Saffron Ice cream, made with rose petal water  and pistachios and saffron,  Just delicious. Definitely we are coming back when we come and visit again!!!

Pee8E8V9TNacOlMsCB3MZg.text: HUGE gyros and mega delicious! Great service and atmosphere. The music playing in the background was so relaxing.

wXXGS8U1kxU1U3Ga-b6Org.text: Food was great & the prices were very competitive. The gyros were humongous and filled with lots of meat  also got the falafel salad and mmmm boy was that amazing!! Will most defiantly be coming back.

Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States

95KfOermde7DbnsZzmwMZw.text: I'm so sad this used to be my favorite Greek restaurant in all of Vegas and Henderson but after the original Greek owners sold the restaurant the food has not been the same. I have been going to this restaurant for 12-13 years. I took family, friends and coworkers to this restaurant, I loved it so much. But the new owners just aren't the same. The salad dressing is all oil and gave me diarrhea twice, I ordered a Chicken Gyro Plate and was given Beef Gyro Meat (took and hour total to make and remake the right order), received chicken that was not fully cooked and tasted like propane or some type of fuel. And the waitress seemed to be struggling with orders, heard other people at the restaurant complaining of getting the wrong food and long wait times. Ugh so frustrating, really disappointed.

zmmxXrQ2epcc55iPoIcMZg.text: This is more of a personal emotional review.   So I never really tried Greek food before. I had just came from kick boxing near by and I wanted to eat a healthy salad and my mom suggested this place.   As soon as I walked in the scenery caught my eye.  It was so beautiful. Blue and white and there large pictures of Greece. My Goodness I suddenly felt like there was apart of me that was missing all along. It really made me emotional.   Being part Greek and not knowing the first thing about being Greek started to frustrate me. I didn't know what the sauces were or Falafel  it all looked so good and it was hard to choose. The lady who served us was beautiful and nice. She didn't speak much to us but she was very sweet.   When our food arrived it looked amazing. Everything was fresh and perfect. The olives they put in the salad is so good. That homemade sauce was so BOMB!! I'll try that place at least once a week or once every two weeks.   I was so urged to take pictures.   Weird memory though it kind of smelled like old mop water but it was when I first walked in. It wasn't that bad.

XlPhLjkAKgloPA3uV2nBSw.text: This place is AMAZING!!  I've had lunch here for few times, and I've nothing but the BEST. So it's time to appreciate them for what they do!  Food is great so as all staff and waiters. They always greet me with a lovely smile and kindness and will make sure that you enjoy your visit! Great variety of delicious Mediterranean food with some choice of Persian style! Owners are lovely couple with a Big heart full of passion for food and customer service. Try it once and you can't get enough of it. Highly recommend. Bon appetit!

VNY7YCzKjtKoxMjI-0-emQ.text: So good! Been craving Mediterranean and found this place! Food took a bit to prepare but that is fine with me! Means everything is fresh to order! I got the gyro with a salad and mango juice! Probably the best gyro I've had . My husband got the Greek lasagna, it was different and so good! We will definitely be coming back here!

PvFesqdsx6km6vtXGa8urg.text: Omg this place is amazing i am a vegetarian and i ordered this dish called veggie alex ! It was superrrrr dooperrrr amaaaaaazing ! It was all vegetarian dish with a side of salad - tiziki sauce which is a cucumber sauce and this amazing yummy delicious rice! U can tell how excited i am writing about it bcuz it was sooooo yummy! I plan to order from them 3-4 times a week for my togo food to have at work!  Must must try! Also i cant tell how how great the owners were! They were so welcoming, warm and super sweet ! They explained the food to me and the made me feel so good being there that i will be going back there again ! This place just became my number 1 restaurant choice !

mFxZCeEklNJSQ4dXPs5CEg.text: Delicious Turkish food, under greek name ). Food is good, meat is tender. Prices are $$. Reason for 4 stars is a servant that did 3 mistakes in half an hour )  But wrap is good, try it)

I took it home, after a few hours in the fridge, it turned into the best I've ever had.  From now on, Ill have my meal there and always order the dip to go.  Better than ice cream and cookies for a midnight snack!!!!

GwZO33wZaoB6YohuM2ZD-w.text: Seriously the best traditional gyros I've ever had and I'm in love with the lemon potatoes! So delicious

yBUDIAosZ7254c8LhFd3ZQ.text: Honestly my favorite Greek food I have ever had, and in my top 5 favorite restaurants. My favorite is their chicken souvlaki dish with rice and Greek salad. SO GOOD! They are also very nice and speedy.

Yi2hPixt1_9VRgY9B2CvUA.text: Hand down BEST GREEK FOOD IN TOWN!! I love this place every time I go in there they are so friendly very authentic place love love love

BKDVYGYF-CIBBJVKQuXt4A.text: Amazing gyros and fries! Tried a few other Mediterranean. Places and this by far is the best!  Service is wonderful! It's worth the travel if your not close.

c8XwRpZAdmrTPjz7pOmbWA.text: We've been customers for over a decade and the food (Gyro's and hummus) is fantastic! The customer service has remained exceptional throughout that time as well. The family owners work very hard and remain sincere.

3-fq5M7mODrL94ZDZTimdQ.text: This place is wonderful. I had the chicken gyro with french fries and they were delicious. The gyro was phenomenal and the  was very filling. I will be back!

VX2eDVh-8b3f9KdAs_o2Ag.text: The food was great and so was the service!! Another one of my favorites because it is FAMILY owned and operated!! Our server was the son and he was funny, sweet and efficient. I would highly recommend from the vegetarian part of the menu, the vegetable (pastry) Not sure of the exact name. I have never experienced a greater Greek meal.

ji1ZfgYLFR5DlBWwQNsRuA.text: Absolutely am never disappointed at any meal here.  One of my favorite places to eat out at; family owned and run with great food and though small, very friendly atmosphere. My family & I have been eating there since they opened & it has always been consistent with large helpings & everything cooked to perfection! Very clean & profesional, the gyro salad is so good & refreshing in this desert heat.

YiMTAkPoUPMJtl9ztXHYeg.text: I yelped this place and was not disappointed. The food was excellent. We had the humus appetizer and it was delicious. Some in our group got the traditional gyro and said it was the best they had ever had. Everything was delicious and fresh.

osuDRmbWeMJo4xbrT-sIoQ.text: I had a craving for Greek food while in Henderson and stumbled across this mom & pop restaurant near Sunset Station. A small & cozy place that has a mural of a city to make you almost feel like you're in Greece plus the some of that great Greek music that makes you dance in your chair...OPA! Oh they did happen to play the Mamma Mia soundtrack while we were there so I felt like I was reenacting the movie but it was still an enjoyable atmosphere.   The owners were great and friendly, providing quick service and checking to make sure that you were satisfied with your meal. Overall we were pleasantly surprised by this place & highly recommend it to those craving Greek and near Galleria mall!   We started with the baba ganoush appetizer and this little sucker packed some flavor. This was the best baba ganoush I have had in a while, not to mention the crispy & soft pita that came with this dish.   For entrees, we ordered a chicken gyro with fries and a beef kabob with rice. Lots of food for the price, yes I thought it was pricey for being a small restaurant but the food quality did make up for the price. The beef was so tender, it melted in your mouth. Salad had a great homemade olive oil dressing. We were happy campers with our meals and stuffed. I was a little sad that I couldn't sample dessert because this truly wouldn't be a great review without dessert. I did, however, settle for a Mythos, which taste like a Heineken.   This place is definitely worth checking out, if not dining than definitely take out as most people were doing.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek beer with an American glass!
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef Kabobs with rice &amp; salad

70tlZFursFnsjwm5jKpx-A.text: Pretty solid Greek food--I ate the gyro salad which was filling but also didn't weigh me down for my afternoon errands. Service was alright as well--seems like a family run place so I don't mind seeing the servers sit down to eat their own meal. Hard for me to believe that at least three Greek restaurants can be supported in this one tiny section of town, but it works because each is delicious.

gg4-EyPSci_G2toAgEaTgw.text: This has got to be the best Greek dining option in Las Vegas.  The food is amazing!  I went with a group of friends Friday night and went back the next day for more.  Everything I tried was delicious.

nzP9cZJmuJrONq3t1kg-BQ.text: What a find !   Leaving Costco (in Henderson) about a week ago, I pulled up Yelp hoping to dine someplace different.   After seeing so many positive reviews and not having any Greek food in quite some time, I gave it a shot.  Fortunately, Yelp guided me is as the restaurant is a little off the Marks Road (and just south Sunset), and the signage is not visible from Marks Road.  The decor is modest but, more importantly,  the staff was very friendly, the menu / selection was decent, and the food / prices were awesome.  During the course of my meals, there was a steady flow of carry out business which is always a good sign.  I plan to visit again - soon!

hMepQWwhBGgP-tMmkD8sZg.text: The only greek food place I go to! The best gyros and hummus I've ever had. Highly recommend this place. Family run and operated. Doesn't get any better!

IzBrAf57JO6UmkBcUa5AEw.text: Went here one random hungry afternoon for lunch. I have always driven by this place but never actually stopped to eat. Now that I know I have no idea why it has taken me so long!! The food is so good!!!!!! Love the mom and pop feel to it. and I love the mom and pops who owns it! they were so sweet and friendly.  I will be coming back!

N8R_ELWVNYY8NI28vAlofg.text: Great quality ingredients, Appealing eating area, friendly and fast for pick up orders.

Q2xTlmD-v83EsY7nLxFJPA.text: The owner is so sweet she makes you feel like you're in her home! Best gyro in Vegas so far!! Everything I've tried has been delicious!

SBuzs24JtmLA6ZgqpXW2xw.text: The restaurant is small with a beautiful picture of a coastal city. There are several beers available, plus greek coffee (similar to espresso) as well as their food menu which includes salads, sandwiches, desserts, etc.   I opted for the falafel wrap and my boyfriend had the gyro platter with the lemon potatoes. We had a baba ganoush appetizer to start, which tasted fresh with a nice eggplant flavor but smelled strongly like peanut oil. It came with soft fluffy pita bread and crispy pita chips. My falafel wrap was alright, with lots of crumbly falafel balls inside of it. It came with a greek salad, which I had wrapped on the side so I could take it for my lunch at work. I enjoyed the salad, especially the fresh dressing that seemed to be made in house, but it was essentially a standard greek salad. My boyfriend was a bit disappointed with his platter, which came with meat strips, the potatoes, salad and sauces. He felt that it was over priced for what it was.   The mythos beer is nice and light, goes well with the flavors in the food.  The service was pleasant and our food came out fairly quickly. The main reason I didn't rate it higher is because the price seemed high compared to similar restaurants in the area and how unremarkable my boyfriend found his meal.

MVTOe_loYnGy6XR4m8vH0A.text: I admit- I was nervous to try hummus for the first time. As well as Greek food. I was blown away by the delicious hummus and Greek lasagna. My mom was so delighted by the food (also a first timer) got an order to go for dinner the next day. The owners were honestly friendly and explained each entree in detail. Please experience this authentic Greek Bistro. You will not be disappointed.

J4HtL8gA3Fpa2cosk1ak8A.text: This place has THE BEST Greek food I've ever had! The best tzatziki ever! The pita chips and bread are delicious. The traditional gyro is great - in part because do the tzatziki and pita bread! Been here twice and the staff is great. Can't wait to go back!

PSPpk6j3wWVeE4rh1_dJuA.text: Our favorite Greek place in town. Good prices and the family that runs it always remembers us.   Things to try: Chicken gyro Chicken salad (has feta, cucumbers, tomatoes and yummy Greek dressing) Pita and hummus  Baklava

oQs2wJ2V2r_F-fqjKLQWcw.text: I've been to Greek Bistro twice now. The first time? Don't quite remember it which usually means the food didn't stand out too much.   I stumbled upon this quaint little restaurant today, all by mistake. I called to order take out, but accidentally called the wrong place. Oops!   When I arrived, (a bit past the 15-20 minutes) the food was still hot. I enjoyed seeing the Greek restaurant was actually ran by GREEK people!  My mother had ordered a Chicken Gyro and I had ordered a Chicken Souvlaki plate. Both came with salad and the souvlaki plate came with the choice of rice or potatoes, all for $24. Reasonable price. I opted for the delicious rice.  As soon as I tasted the rice, with some Tzatziki I added, my taste buds had an explosion. It was delicious! The pita bread tasted homemade and  was extremely soft and delicious. The chicken was good, but I have had better. It was really tender, hot, and satisfying. Yet, it seemed like there wasn't enough flavor or maybe too strong of a certain flavor. All together, the chicken, rice, and pita in the Chicken Souvlaki plate were enjoyed! They were actually devoured! The salad was just as amazing with not too much dressing, nor too little dressing. So yummy! My mother said she loved the gyro. I took a bite and agreed to disagree. The  chicken wasn't what I would've expected. I don't know if it had too many condiments or such, but it could have been better. Much better. The chicken in the souvlaki plate tasted somewhat better.   I might be back, I might not. Depends on whether I call the right place next time!

s8YdT9v2rsOkG30qJfwccQ.text: A double-whammy of excellence - great food and service.  Have been here multiple times and have always received a wonderful experience. Love the fact that their gyro meat is moist and tasty which contrasts the dried out bland meat at other Greek wanna-be establishments.  Being family operated certainly makes the difference.  Even the most basic Greek dish (gyro) is served with all the attention it deserves to keep diners happy. The baklava is a heavenly desert - rich and yummy.  Oh, every time someone enters the Greek Bistro they are welcomed with a sincere greeting.  Even if you are not necessarily a Greek food fan you gotta at least try this bistro simply for the quality of the food. Their strip mall store front-like location makes this place a hidden gem as it's off the main road - almost hidden right off of Sunset Station's open air parking lot (East side) and behind Wildfire casino.  Enjoy!

d-W_Vl2zsRZzXUf5kt6csA.text: Super clean, standard Grecian blue and white interior, laid out like a mom and pop eatery.  Service is expedient and friendly. Food is middle of road good. I had the lamb kebab served with, Greek salad, pita and lemon potatoes. It was filling and tasty. The rice pudding is American style dessert where the emphasis is on sugar. The rice was baby food soft instead of al dente, but if you're into sugary milk stuff, this you.

zPRlxMomdMvIqckatZm97A.text: The best gyros in town!!! The pita bread itself has a good flavor to it, unlike the generic pita breads out there...the chicken greek salad and the hummus are also good it makes you want to come back!!! Great staff and a great, clean place to eat...Highly Recommended!!!

LDWY79-pCze3DX397zhitw.text: Greet food great customer service, Clean, the owners are very nice and try to do their best.  Highly recommended

m63Sxiw1r4aINS_lqYkT-Q.text: I was in the area with my friend and her daughter, so I figured it was a great opportunity to check out a new spot. Plus, I LOVE Greek food!  Falafel ($5.95): Appetizer version comes with four falafel, lettuce, tomato, pita bread, and tahini sauce. The falafel is DELICIOUS. The flavor and seasonings are so good, it almost makes me not want to eat meat (almost). I loved the tahini too.  Tzatziki ($5.55): A very generous portion of this popular Greek yogurt dip served with warm pita bread and small pita chips. I really enjoyed their version of tzatziki; perfect balance of flavors. Also, I thought it was so neat that you have options with soft, fluffy pita bread or crunchy pita chips. I preferred the bread with tzatziki, whereas the chips were fantastic with tahini.  Traditional Gyro ($8.99): Stuffed with the famous gyro meat, lettuce, tomato, red onion, and of course, tzatziki. Stuffed is a pretty accurate description since this sandwich is HUGE! It's also delicious. It's served with Greek Fries or Salad (I opted for the fries). The fries have a wonderful seasoning on them, but lacked in salt and flavor. Not a difficult problem to fix with a little help from table salt, however, they still rated rather low on my "Favorite Fries List."  My friend ordered the Chicken Gyro and fortunately, I tried their fantastic chicken! It's moist and very flavorful. Even the little one really enjoyed it. I rarely order chicken in Greek restaurants since I love gyro meat so much, but their chicken is convincing.  Service was great, too. The young gentleman assisting us was prompt with his service throughout our meal, accommodating, and very kind. He was so sweet with the baby!

FGGpFYffW31yRqmgI8EoYg.text: I wanted to check Greek Bistro out after seeing some of the reviews on Yelp and I'm glad I did. It's a perfect hidden gem just outside of Sunset Station and I drove past it the first visit.  -the interior is decked out in the blue and white colors of the Greece flag and is very bright and clean, no dim lighting to hide anything here. Greeted by a woman who may be the owner we were given a menu and she answered all of our questions.  -I had my usual Greek favorite, salad with Gyro meat on top. A very large portion of lettuce, tomato, onions feta, olives and topped with Gyro meat and served with dressing and tzatziki sauce. It was very good and definitely filling. I tried one of my wife's falafel balls and these were also excellent  -There are many Greek places in the area and this ranks up there with the best of them. I will be going here frequently!

RFgDcVPYT9nwqPe76y82Sg.text: We used to frequent this place when we lived in Hendertucky, way before spots like Thelma's, Penn's, and Great Greek existed.  This was plan B after Great Greek had closed up shop due to selling out of food!?!?!(that's what we were told) We shared an Avgolemono, Wifey got the Chicken Gyro with Greek Fries, and I decided to go with the owner's suggestion of the Moussaka.  The Avgolemono was okay, but we preferred Great Greek's version better. However, we preferred the Gyro and fries here, even though the portion was a bit smaller, Greek Bistro still gets our vote. The seasoned fries with the yogurt dip are so addicting! The Moussaka came with a side salad and was very delicious and quite filling.  Greek Bistro is a great alternative if Great Greek is closed for the day and you're craving some Greek grindage...ALOHA!!!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(19/100) "Greek Grindz"

hooa_glEXobk1JkaeDgFBw.text: This place is such an incredible, family owned restaurant!  I am so happy that we finally stopped in for lunch recently.  I was nearby at Costco, filling up my tank, and was starving. I thought Greek food sounded yummy, and I knew this place was close, so we decided to try it.  First of all, it's really cute. I love the decor, with the blue chairs and the mural of Greece on the wall.  We entered the restaurant and were immediately greeted by a nice young guy at the counter. When we said we were eating in, he said we could sit anywhere we'd like, and he brought us menus.  We decided to share hummus to start.  It was really tasty and served with fresh pita bread, as well as pita chips.  I think the chips may have been baked and they were really the highlight - they were SO good!  Then we shared the gyro plate, even though I wasn't sure it would be enough food.  Boy was I wrong! It was more than enough for 2 hungry people and it was so delicious.  The meat was some of the tastiest I have ever had, the tzatziki was fresh and the salad was huge!   The service was pretty much invisible, which is totally OK. I don't need a lot of attention to enjoy my meal.  It's a family owned place, and everyone was very friendly.  We really enjoyed our meal and are looking forward to going back again soon.

arbrn4SXZQqyjesc9Lfh1Q.text: BEST GYROS IN LAS VEGAS!!!!   This place is phenomenal! Traditional Gyro is the best I have ever had, hands down. Their lamb is succulent and amazing. They also serve Greek seasoned fries with your Gyro. The restaurant has a very authentic feel and you can see that it is family owned. The server was very nice and explained everything on the menu.   This family takes pride in their food and it's evident in the taste. I will never eat a Gyro at another restaurant again.

g78bc8_0MgIeIwa6jPMxUA.text: While my husband and I don't eat Greek food often, we were pleasantly pleased! Conveniently located in the same parking lot of our hotel, the Palace station, we were able to walk there and were seated right away. I ordered the lamb gyro which was soooo good-the lamb was moist, soft, flavorful and generously portioned; the tsaziki sauce was yummy; the pita was warm and soft; and the Greek salad was tasty! Not to mention, our server, raphi, was such a kind, personable and lively young man. We were able to have a great conversation about his academic endeavors, travel and food.

nr7R7Il94_bVwaBRqg9s-g.text: I was hesitant to try this place out since it was so close to The Great Greek. The reviews are half what GG has but the stars came out to be about the same. It's a little slower paced here and not as prosperous as GG. Food wise, it is very tasty and cooked well. The service is very friendly. We ordered 3 traditional gyros and a chicken salad. Why 3 gyros? No one wanted to share theirs I guess, me included. The fries is crunchy and seasoned. There was no oily residue. The traditional gyro was made of lamb and beef that they ground into a pate meat. I was afraid it was prepackaged from Uncle Sam...Sam Walton that is (he of beat up pick-up for Wal-mart grand openings while family are each multibillionaire jetsetters fame). But the smarter half said that's how they make it, they put it through a grinder. You can see the kitchen from the counter so I suppose if you had no shame you can stand there and just watch them feed the machine. The dish came with a side of yogurt mayo kind of dressing which was perfect for the fries. I used both ketchup and the yogurt mix. The rest of my table preferred the yogurt only but I put ketchup on my fried chicken and rice sometimes so I slathered it in my fries of course. Relax, it's Heinz not Hunt's catsup. Overall, GG prob a tad better but this is not a bad alternative either. They have different dishes and both make their dishes well. The chicken salad was well made, seasoned grilled chicken, plenty of romaine lettuce (I think) and some tart olives to keep you awake in case you got a case of food coma. Prices are about the same as GG. We went in at about 5:30ish so there were plenty of tables, come 6pm, most of the tables were filled. One chicken salad, 3 gyros, and 2 beers came out to be around $44. I think the salad was about ~$10.95 and the gyros at ~$8.95.  Being a block away from each other maybe they know each other or are related? They had a cute/weird phrase above the counter...."the heart of Greece lies in its food every bite is like a kiss." It might be one of the few times where I got lucky and didn't know about it. If I knew earlier, I would've brought my Chapstick.

I ordered the chicken soulvaki plate which came with a greek salad, your choice of potatoes (i had the greek potatoes), chicken, and a soft pita. The pita, as other posters have mentioned is really soft and fresh, homemade tasting. The food tasted great, but the portion size for the $13.99 I paid was shocking.  Yes, it was to-go, but still...I'm used to paying about $10.00 for the same back home and the portion size is huge. It came in a styrofoam takeout container with the chicken in the larger area, the greek salad in the smaller area, and greek potatoes in the smallest...there were 3 quarters of potatoes.  The food is good, but I think they overcharge slightly based on what you actually get. Maybe it's larger if you dine in, but I'm not sure. I may or may not go back.

rtxw2w0oifMCQqKscMRWew.text: So...I almost didn't want to share this review because I don't want this place to become too known. Haha hidden treasures are the best. 9aBsA3i-Pldh5EYDkUj_3Q.text: I absolutely adore Greek Bistro. The food is positively phenomenal, full of flavor and perfect portions. My favorite dish is the gyro with fries because the gyro is delicious and the fries come with this amazing seasoning that I haven't had anywhere else.   Whenever I call my order in, the service over the phone is friendly and efficient and my order is always ready on time. Anytime I go to different Greek restaurants, I find myself comparing them to Greek Bistro and I'm always disappointed. No one comes close to Greek Bistro's deliciousness!  My only complaint is that there is only one location because I made the mistake of moving across town. I always make it a priority to stop by and eat there when I have errands nearby.

upxzq5xYrFpRVGdZNAUhig.text: This is one of the closest restaurants to where I've called home for over 5 years, and I hadn't ever tried it. Today, I told myself "no more excuses."  Yes, I finally went to Greek Bistro. It's exactly what it says on the tin: a small Greek restaurant, hidden in a small strip mall behind Wildfire Casino and on the outer circle of the "ring" surrounding Sunset Station. I stopped in after 1:30 for a late lunch, finding a surprising number of tables occupied but with plenty open for myself. The blue-heavy decor is charming in its way, but I would probably not order dine-in here if I wasn't so concerned about eating freshly prepared food.  [Rambling personal story warning!] I wasn't always as ambitious with trying unfamiliar businesses as I am now, and none of my friends ever invited me to try this place back in my first few years around. I finally did invite someone to try it with me around Christmastime 2015, but they had closed early on that evening, so I pushed it to the back of my mind again. Lately, I've found myself more and more frequently bemoaning the lack of great food on my side of Henderson, so I finally had to address one of the biggest potential counterarguments.  The young man who greeted me was quick with asking for my order and surprisingly quicker coming back around after I asked for some time to think about my order. Truth be told, I was stalling to take menu photos, a challenge that became far easier after a woman who is presumably the owner offered me a to-go menu. This version didn't have the reflective plastic cover that their standard menu does, and prices were consistent. And the food was good, even great at times.  I had the traditional gyro sandwich ($8.99) with fries, and the gyro was certainly one of the better ones that I've had to try. Delicious tzatziki and fresh lettuce, tomato, and red onions adorned the beef and lamb slices, which were still the star of the dish. The pita was solid, not exceptional. I was disappointed by the lack of salt in the fries themselves, which can only be covered up so far by the seasoning or by extra salt, and the surprising slight dryness of the fries' interior. The tzatziki was a fun dip for the fries though, and I found myself using the tzatziki to pick up seasoning from the bottom of the tray. That aside, I would order the small salad instead of the fries.  Dessert was better. The baklava ($4.25) is a surprisingly huge square-shaped portion that's roughly 3 inches per side. I would not recommend taking it on alone, and I even ended up asking for a to-go box despite (or because of) how much I enjoyed it. When you break into the baklava, honey oozes out of the crispy fillo dough with a layer of crushed walnuts inside and a garnish of crushed pistachios on top. The flavor is somehow richer and more nuanced than other baklavas that I've had in the past. I was very wrong about this neighborhood not having good desserts, and I'll be sure to try their other sweets now that I know where to look.  I also ordered a moussaka ($13.95) to-go. I hadn't had this dish in ages, but I'd always fondly remembered the eggplant and ground beef layered dish that I'd tried years ago, and this brought me back. Loved the spices in the moussaka as well as the side salad of lettuce, cucumber, red onion, tomato, and feta. There's an additional side of seemingly the same sauce that bathes the moussaka, and I wasn't sure what to do with it except just enjoy it slowly with every bite of the moussaka. The portion is a bit more of a huge lunch or solid dinner, so you might consider sharing it. Moussaka, baklava, and maybe an appetizer? Sounds like a great meal for two right there.  Greek Bistro is an enjoyable restaurant that may indeed be the gem of this mostly chain-ridden side of town. I'll definitely explore their menu further, and I won't wait another 5 years to do so.

YM1-ja7qg3z3SLM-FrN1KQ.text: Just what the Doctor ordered! Needed a new Greek spot since relocating to Henderson. Quite impressed! I'll definitely be back to this place. Chicken gyro was on point.. I couldn't decide on my side so o I got both, and they both exceeded my expectations. The Greek fries..YUMMY! The salad, refreshing!

S3if3bVOV6qqHDVvsMBBFQ.text: Quaint family run business.  Murals of Greece on the walls.  Large portions.  The woman owner is very sweet and gives great service.  The steak kabobs are delicious and tender.  Good salads, taziki, hummus and spanokopita.  They also serve beer and wine.  Casual and delicious.

1tqhqaPYyYrjVRNe3Tbnpg.text: I have been looking for a good Greek restaurant for some time. My expectations are high as I am Greek American and both parents were excellent cooks. I tried dolmades and mousaka...delicious! Gotta have that hint of cinnamon which is a trademark of Greek cooking. Also the shrimp with spinach rice is excellent too. Highly recommend this little bistro and am looking forward to trying the rest of the menu!

YpdxzpiQ1lmExYtl27S5gg.text: The Greek bistro is the perfect bang for your buck, the food, customer service, and amazing atmosphere with friendly faces. Greek Bistro's is a amazing restaurant with a focus on taste and food presentation, I haven't tried all the food options yet but I feel that the gyro and kabob is second to none with a colorful and tasty palette all at a affordable price and getting you filled right up every time. I've been coming to this restaurant 1-2 every other week , always meeting the same friendly faces every time I show up.  I would give a 6/5 if I can :)

wKGIu215Wc-AfiLcZaVFng.text: I found this place on Yelp and decided to give a try after I read some reviews. I had Keftedakia kabob and appt.  Eggplant dip ( baba ganoush) and both were delicious . Stuff was very friendly and very helpful.I am definitely coming back.

zpc9CH_v7vslWfOeSt1sHQ.text: One of the best Mediterranean restaurant In the neighborhood and in Vegas. Very nice staff and good costumer service  Fresh and delicious food Highly recommended

-l4WGpg7yyt4XaJlaJd8TA.text: We've been here dozens of times. This place gets fast full during lunch, as well as dinner. Be prepared to say hello to friendly tourists. Inconspicuously located just east of the Sunset Station Casino Hotel, you will be welcomed by very pleasant Greek Orthodox owners who migrated from Persia to Armenia. Their friendly son serves at Lunch Time. At dinner time, meet the husband and wife owners who show their care for providing excellent service in a "mom and pop" environment. We both ordered Gyros Sandwiches. Mary ordered the NO SALT Fries while I brazenly ordered the very tasty salted herb chili fries with tzatsizi yogurt/cucumber sauce (which made me happy but later in the evening raised my blood pressure in the evening).  UNDOUBTEDLY this place reminds us of our go to Gyros stop back in Munich, Germany and is by far the best place for Gyros in Henderson. Compared to the other smoky places, we keep coming back here after our shopping at the nearby Costco, TJ Maxx and other fashion stores around.

D9bAQ-rpR-l8rqhLUj0GrA.text: I love everything at the Greek Bistro but my favorite are the Gyro wrap (the meet is sooo fresh) and feta fries!!!!!!!!!!! I am from LA but when I go to Vegas my first stop is always at the Greek Bistro. Amazing food and best service.   P.s.  I give 5 stars for the cleanness of the place, 5 stars for service, and 5 stars for the food!!!!

C2pZIvYjKNeT4WBoajUCdA.text: This place is amazing! The best tzadziki sauce I've ever had! Not to mention the authenticity of the flavors here. If you are looking for great Greek food, this place is a must! Yum!

The moussaka is absolutely amazing, the chicken souvlaki is killer, and the hummus is some of the best I've had.  I have never had a bad meal here, and the owner is sweeter than her baklava.

ww_EZEvtHcUvjCkCYoZdJw.text: I love this place! I've been trying all if the amazing Greek food in this town but this place was soooo delicious. I had the Babaganoush app and the Moussaka for my entree. It was the best I've ever had! The people are super friendly and service was top notch. This restaurant has a very home style feel which I think makes the food taste even better! If you are looking for some tasty Greek food, head to this place. You won't be disappointed!!!

fCQeoYjdo7x9QiWH-tDLUQ.text: This is a definite stop for us when in the area of Galleria Mall. My favorite place for a tasty gyro,  my choice being the chicken which is perfectly grilled breast. Try their falafel, you'll not be disappointed, seasonings are perfect. If you have some room and a sweet tooth, the desserts are surprisingly delicious. I have told them they need to open up in the mall or in a casino location.  The food is way to good to see them fail.  Especially with places like mad Greek and that place at the mall Kylos Greek cafe (horrible).    If you want a family friendly great Greek food give them a try you won't be disappointed. The food is absolutely fantastic and authentic. It's great. I'm all for family owned small businesses. This place is a favorite spot for my fella and I, and a go to whenever we have friends in town.

oM0KLTysrzVnM0jPHnxMKg.text: This was my first time here. The first time for a Greek restaurant for that matter. The filet and lamb kabobs were tender and juicy. The value is excellent for the price. The service was prompt and courteous. I will be coming back again. I am now a Greek food fan. Thank you Niki for the great service.

K1AwTd4_0QBESy6ud5Hdpw.text: Always a go-to Greek restaurant on this side of town. My wife and I live 20-30 miles away. But we always come when we have the chance. Gyro is delish. And the service tops it all off.

ZHhZ8IXIgKq7SprBsVehGw.text: I came in to Greek Bistro a couple of years ago just to check out the menu but I had not ordered anything until today. I had been wanting mousaka but did not recall seeing on the menu. It may not have been offered before but it is offered now so that is what I ordered for lunch today. I took it to go.  My mousaka meal came with a side salad and pita bread. The salad was cool and crisp. The dressing was a nice vineagrette. The one olive was a good briney addition. The pita, on the other hand, was not good. I ate one of the four triangles and spit out the first bite of the next piece. I did not finish it. There was an off taste to it. Bitter like old oil. Unfortunate. At least the mousaka was alright. I'd have been really pissed had it been terrible.  But the mousaka was not terrible. It was most definitely different than I was expecting. I know mousaka to be a dish of layered sliced potato, eggplant and beef (like a lasagna) topped with a creamy Bechamel sauce. This was almost like a shepherds pie. There was mashed potatoes on top followed by ground beef and a layer of eggplant on the bottom. There was some kind of red sauce in the mix. While the basics were there, this was wholly different than what I have had before. It wasn't bad but it wasn't exactly what I was looking for either.   Service was alright. Friendly enough. My meal was up in about 10 minutes as I was told it would be. The interior is simple but nice. Clean as well. And the food cooking in the back smelled incredible. But in the end, I wish I had enjoyed this experience more than I did. And thus concludes my final review of 2018.

pXh854TPNnlX8wIZW-Of0Q.text: After driving past here literally 500 times over the past several years, I finally stopped by. Usually I go to another Greek restaurant a little South of here..  Gotta say, one of the Top 2 or 3 grilled chicken kabob/sandwich/pitas I've ever had. A LOT of meat. Most places when you're half way through the pita sandwich, you realize they shoved all the meat at the open end, to look "full," only to leave you with veggies and sauce in the last half. Not this place. Very full and tasty!  The side salad was a good size and tasted like a typical Greek salad. I hate olives, but if I liked em, I might've been bothered by only getting one in my salad. "Fresh" is an overrated word when it comes to describing food, but this place deserves it.  I don't see why others say this isn't as authentic a atmosphere as other Greek restaurants. I don't give a crap who works here, as long as the food is great.. but I know several people that won't eat at certain places unless the people making it are of the same ethnicity as the food. For example, my mom won't eat Mexican food unless it's Mexicans making the food. Sushi Twister north of here even uses this to it's advantage with their slogan: "Japanese owned and operated." My point is everyone from the Mexican lady that made my food to the Asian lady that took my order would not defer me from a "authentic Greek experience." Haha, get over it, and just enjoy the food.  My review will turn into a 5 star with a couple more near perfect visits. Great job, and great food so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken gyro and side salad(instead of fries)

l4EST_y1cyaWZ5uk9abxIg.text: Awesome food and great service! My fam started coming here at first because some of the other mediterranean places we go to have closed. Glad we walked in here. We've been coming back ever since!
