OO-Q20HjMeZzuvwtxzKyqQ.text: I was introduced to this mom and pop shop by a client and I have to say they have the best falafel's in town. What' makes them the best. Well first off, bursting with flavor and secondly, not dried out like most places I've been to. Seriously, this small cafe and throw down with the well known spots. We also indulged in their salads and let me say simple goes a long way. Their Greek salads left us full and satisfied. We all had different variations of it and the fact that they keep the dressing separate as a standard keeps me and my belly happy. We like to make those important life choices ourselves. The meats on the salads are tasty and not tough to chew like others I've been to. Now I know when I'm in the area I can stop by and get me a Greek dish when the cravings hit.

3cIdNmy10kRLIczRehuBDA.text: One of the best greek food I have had. Ordered the traditional greek gyro. Highly recommend it and great service.

Tuq4L1SFWT9heEIg7K98PA.text: Just had a delicious lunch with my hubby. The traditional gyro was perfect. It came with fries that were good and a little spicy. This is a sit down restaurant but the prices are very reasonable. We will definitely be back.

I loved the chicken gyro. The vegetables and chicken were cooked perfectly, and the fries, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce had outstanding flavor. The service was fast and accurate, the manager was very nice, the employees were attentive, and the restaurant was nicely decorated and clean. Will definitely be visiting again.

GU4NIqm8aVPA8W8eA2H3iA.text: Wednesday night and Earl wanted Greek food.  We drove over to Great Greek, but sadly, the place was closed.  I yelped and it suppose to be open!  WTH?  I called and the recording mentioned that they will be closing from blah blah to blah blah.  Therefore, we defaulted to Greek Bistro.  I got the gyro sandwich with fries, and Earl got the chicken salad with a side of falafel (appetizer).  The falafel appetizer came with babaganoush and slices of pita.    I really enjoyed my food.  I ate half of it and was super full already.  Earl ate the rest of the gyro.  My sandwich was stuffed with delicious tender, flavorful slices of gryo.  I also liked the greek fries with the yogurt dip.  Yummy!  Earl's salad was a salad.    Overall, we are fans of Greek Bistro and will always be on our to go to for Greek food.

wOz0ldtYWFJszniBfhAXrQ.text: This is the second time I have been here. The food is always so fresh and so good. The service is good and because this is a family owned place, they treat you like family. We will continue to come back!

a0GPT4Ipw2DaUWXJJR5K3g.text: We had dinner which was delightful. There are about 8 tables in the restaurant. We were meet by I believe was one of the owners. She told us to sit where we wanted to. She was very nice and helpful with the items on the menu. There were four of us. For appetizers we had Hummus and Babaganoush. Which came with warm Pita bread and Pita chips. For our main course we had lamb Souvlaki, Spanakopita, Mousakka and, Shrimp ala Greek. Each came with a Greek salad. The appetizers were delicious. I had never tried Babaganoush before but my sister in law suggested it. The wine she suggested paired well with our meal. Everyone was very happy with their meals. We got some Baklava for later. The meal was very reasonably priced and the service was very good. We have had Baklava before and this was different it had a slight lemony flavor to it which I really liked.

WgPCpgidq02KSNS04hufig.text: Great food awesome service,there's not 1 thing bad on this menu. The meat is beyond moist both chicken and lamb.

I got the traditional Gyro served with a Greek salad. My mom got the Moussaka. I love Moussaka as well so I took a taste of it. It was made perfectly and so delicious! My Gyro was awesome...it was very large and I ended up eating the entire thing. The salad was delicious as well. I will definitely visit again and I look forward to trying other items on the menu.

JNijPGPP0RFcSbwJeuEOcw.text: Ok folks let's talk Greek food. I Love greek food and I have been eyeing this place for a long time but haven't gone because the outside doesn't look like much. Thank God I took a chance to go into this establishment! It's like relaxed 5 star dining. The inside is WAAAAAAAAY different than the outside. It is small and beautifully done. I ABSOLUTELY love the decor. I almost wish there were no TVs in it as I feel it takes away from such a beautiful "Bistro". Plus if there was outdoor seating it would be AMAZING! You can see the kitchen from the dining room and can just tell how professional this Restaurant is. It was busy with prep. Everyone was dressed the same and still put out AMAZING FOOD! I came here for my birthday and ordered the Dolmades for an appetizer and the lamb shank for my main dish.  My server was this beautiful young lady who has a GREAT presence about her. The dolmades came out and there was bread a tzatziki sauce. Now I Love Dolmades and usually they taste a lot alike. This place has an extra seasoning on them that I can't quite make out...   who the hell cares they were DA BOMB! I gobbled those things up lickety split and the bread with that sauce..  I could have died right there but then I wouldn't have had the chance to taste the lamb shank. The Lamb shank comes out and is huge (I thought I was fred flintstone for a moment). It's served with rice and more bread..  SCORE!!!! It's been 2 days and I can't get that lamb shank out of my mind....I would marry that lamb shank. It is served with a tomato sauce and is out of this world. The meat was so tender and flavorful....I swear I was in Greece at a Michelin star bistro.  I want to go everyday and eat that. It would be my last meal. The rice was cooked to perfection as it was seasoned well and you could taste every grain. The bread of course was phenomenal as usual. Plus the price is WAAAAAAY ON POINT! You get to have a 100$ Plate of food with appetizers and a drink for under 30$......ARE YOU SERIOUS? Yes I Am! You KICK ASS GREEK BISTRO!! My hat is off to the Chef and all the staff and owner. You get my highest honor 17 Platinum stars and a BAZINGA!!!! WOOOOOOOHOOOOOOOO!

eYWNEU1fJEqGht1lxBBctw.text: Quick service and they offered a discount if I wrote a review now. So far, I am pleased with service, and hope food is just as good.  Update: The food was delicious!  I had the chicken gyro with only meat and lettuce.  The chicken was so flavorful and juicy that it really didn't need anything else on it.  I would highly recommend this place, and I will definitely be back.

hAP701IvveI9TUIm1EE6Mw.text: We tried this place via GrubHub for the first time. We are big fans of The Great Greek, but Bistro had a $5 off coupon and we liked the ratings.  The photos of the dishes looked really appetizing!  I ordered the Gyro Salad, spanakopita plate (though I'd prefer it as an appetizer size) and my husband ordered the Filet steak plate.  The best part of the meal was indeed the Spanakopita-- better than the Great Greek's. Unfortunately, that's where the comparison ends.   My Gyro meat looked and tasted like day-old dehydrated meat. No flavor and looked like leather. Does this place serve the crappy dried out pieces for delivery because we're not dining in and can't send it back?  I got about 3 small curds of Feta in the Salad. So I basically paid for a very expensive lettuce and cucumber salad.  My husband's steak was ordered medium rare and  delivered well done. He liked the presentation though. For $50, I expected this meal to be on par or better than The Great Greek.   Needless to say, unless I'm in the mood for $12 worth of spanakopita, we'll NEVER order from this place again.

X1LGCCW_PVBdXrRvLWdK2Q.text: What can I say?! The food here is absolutely delicious! I especially love their Greek salad dressing! I've been here a few times now - I've dined in and ordered for take out. Consistently very good. The food is cooked fresh to order and while it may take a bit longer to receive, it's always well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Sit down to dine in or order take out at the counter.

RGyr2eJvMvXKhTyPtNx7eg.text: Closest thing to Greece ! I definitely recommend you coming here . The gyro was on point . They even got Mythos !!! Great customer service and amazing ambience

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States

0Hbd6RR09-e5U4A1A1MwHA.text: I love the food here!! The gyro plate is my favorite!!  That would be the # 13!! The salads are second to none!! The desserts are top notch as well!! I'm not a huge baklava fan, but they are tasty a Hell here!! This place is always busy and for good, make that great reasons!! Very friendly and efficient staff!  Once you walk in the door you are made to feel at home!! This place never fails to exceed all expectations!!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. The delicious salad!!
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. The #21!!

hc72xLWHMXSLhJhJsEzq_Q.text: 2 different friends, who do not know each other, recommended I try Greek Bistro in the same week. So, my curiosity was definitely piqued!! This place is slightly out of my way & I feel like it doesn't look like much from the outside so I am really glad someone told me about it.  Based on my experience, I have no clue why there isn't a line out of the door, but I'm glad there wasn't. It was SO good!!!  I am fairly new to loving Greek food, but I definitely have my go to favourites & this place has all of them. I had a hard time deciding what to get, but ultimately went with Spanokopita ($10) & Dolmades ($6) with a glass of Pinot Noir ($6). They were amazing!!! The dolmades came with tzatziki & pita bread. The pita was warm & soft & fabulous. I'm not sure the spanokopita was super traditional. It might be, but it was different from other places I've had it...the flaky dough was almost the consistency of a croissant. Buttery. Flaky. Delicious.  My husband had the Gyro ($10) and said it was the 2nd best one he has ever had. Soft warm pita with a generous helping of lamb and veggies.  The Desserts are all $5. I only had the Baklava, but I definitely need to try the others, especially the Namoorah!!  I will, without question, be back to try the Falafel & Hummus!!  If you are a fan of Greek food, please give this place a try. The service is good. The food is awesome. And, the price is right!!

u-oJBlrCTwfnYzjeyGMrxA.text: First time at the Greek Bistro and let me tell you guys something....best freakin' Dolmades in town. We also had the filet mignon dish and the meat was to die for. I definitely recommend this place.

6sBTFw0tRFjXElGzqxM-iA.text: Great food and service. I usually get the chicken gyro with greek fries. The chicken tastes good with a fresh pita, the fries are seasoned well and taste great.

hPRkXAM7lUpD4_r82JnGog.text: This is my favorite Greek restaurant! My husband and I found this place over a year ago, and we've been coming here almost 3 times a month since. The owner is so nice, and we always feel welcomed. They already memorize our order. I love everything on the menu, but I mostly order the chicken kabob plate or the kaftedakia plate. ZJU-7LquqrPm9H97h9tazA.text: We found this place on yelp after a long flight cross country. We couldn't have been happier to find the best Greek food we've had in a long time! We can't wait to come back! This place is legit!! You know when you find local elderly greek women eating here on a Saturday night that it's authentic! The staff and owner couldn't have been nicer! 5 Stars!!

2SI6g5EnXuURkKKrxcnkfQ.text: Great food and great service. This is one of our new favorite spots in Henderson. Not pricy and delicious food.

pxUS7Nfq_lczlDJjGfx26Q.text: Food & service are great! Feels like you're having dinner @ the home of greek friends (price is very reasonable too!)

zZFgdrK3o2cqCZQkn7kcMA.text: I'll be honest I am not always in the mood for Greek food perhaps it's the lack of good Greek food.  But cravings are back with this place.   My most favorite soup is served here, their "Avgolemono". I could eat this soup any day and every day!  But there have been times where they run out...and I can't tell you how disappointing this can be. We also order the Gyro with Greek Fries, spanakopita and the Moussaka also very delicious.  They also have combos and a must try is also their rice pudding!   Service is not always the greatest but as long as they keep that Avgolemono soup cooking I'll be back again and again!

74X3t344_JzN0PypLnuykw.text: FAVORITE GREEK RESTAURANT. Love love love this place. I'm very critical when it comes to my Greek food, but these guys know exactly what they're doing. Always come here when I'm in Nevada, and they never disappoint. Their salads, gyros, fries, everything is so tasty and delicious. If you're in the area definitely give this place a try, you won't be disappointed (: and I also love how fast they are as well!

fPgUmHHqorWeDqWaz4t2jw.text: This would be a 5 star on the food but the phone system sucks. Waited 15 minutes on the phone to place a take out order for my BDay. I drove there still on hold....i had the waiter pick up the phone to answer my call on hold.

ZGn4NCjCkzV2bV5vFH6RWQ.text: Oh my...gyro salad was DELISH!  Price was less than most other Greek places in town also (buy at least $2)...the place is definitely a dive, but hey, who cares!  The food is good, quick, and nice employees

A7JF9fDY8DhuKw3kLS2TRg.text: A cute, family owned Greek restaurant in a small nondescript strip mall near the Sunset Casino in Henderson. Love the moussaka and gyros. Their Tzatziki is to die for. Highly recommend!

OmZpyMccjkbwiSrMMfTCIg.text: This was our first official meal as Nevada residents & we will be coming back!  Everything was delicious & fresh.  We had the falafel appetizer, chicken souvlaki & filet mignon souvlaki (both with lemon potatoes). Just AMAZING!

JcPe44BDvmag7veijMSq0A.text: Awesome family-owned Greek place! The food was delicious. One of my favorite things to eat is hummus and their's was fantastic. I loved the pita chips - nice touch. Came with friends and the employees were all so sweet to us and both of our infants. Greek salad with chicken comes with so much chicken - great portions. We were served quickly and they were great about staying on top of our drinks. Will be back!

rZ-WYhJpZON88zZJ7Wl6fw.text: I am from NYC but as soon as I tasted the homemade grape leaves decided I want to move here!!  Everything is delicious and fresh. You can't go wrong.

wDBH5gDSPhSTbqPgOLv8TQ.text: This place is the bizomb!!!! Was going to another Greek restaurant in the area, but got there and discovered they closed down. Thanks God because otherwise I wouldn't have found the Greek Bistro.  I've eaten tons if gyros before (if you don't believe me just check out my FB profile for proof of my waistline) and this one stacks up among the best. Super fresh, great tzatziki, great flat bread & lots of moist & juicy lamb. Can you say nomnom?!? I can't because my mouth is full of gyro, yo!!!    A little on the pricey side at $10.81 for gyro, fries & drink, but def worth it. The gyro is huge & lots of Greek fries (BTW, the fries are awesome too).  Definitely coming back to this place.  He'll, I would scale Mt. Olympus to get back to this place.  I'll be dreaming in Greek tonight - no doubt!

foRbYq0B7_ILxdxTy_0E6Q.text: I LOVE this place!  From start to finish, this has become one of my most favorite restaurants in town.   The family who owns the business are all so nice and helpful, and very, very welcoming.  The food is to die for as well- my favorite is their Shrimp a la Greek and my husband is hooked on their lamb shank.  Fresh Mediterranean salads on the side, and a sinfully delicious baklava to finish it all up... we leave full and smiling each and every visit.  You will too!

QXftJVnTQy-e8Sb61OCvJg.text: We ordered the traditional gyro, one with fries and the other with salad. The portion was large and it was good. Staff was friendly and the place was clean. I would definitely go back.

ItU16I-nKWJ95z-4p8XA0w.text: Just went to get TAKE OUT & food is still hot and tasted so good every time !!!!

CdTuWnV62kjKikpayjT10Q.text: Great food. The lemon potatoes were amazing.  The chicken kabob was tender and tasty. Definitely a must try for Greek food.

6cTlUqZ7u6x0a4Llc8OXLw.text: This was my second time, third time for my wife at this restaurant and we don't mind driving from anywhere in Las Vegas to go eat here. The best lamb shank i ever had in this country and seems like the Mediterraneans know how to cook the lamb. We had to call in before get there to make sure they still have their lamb shank because sometimes they get huge orders and they run out of those very quickly. Their gyros are very juicy and their fries are unique because they put sesame seeds in their seasoned fries. Also, if you have never tried a Greek beer this is a good place to do so.

G157lvgCI0HmQ5a-fWR2Iw.text: Had lunch there and everything was tasty.  This is my go to greek spot in town.  Gyros, of course are good. But their fries are super good.

niZ1jyMkL3v66tXiOsQjSw.text: The best gyro meat I've ever had. The pita is so soft. The tzatziki appetizer and their salads are to die for. So so so good! Mine and my husbands favorite place to eat. I'm part Greek, raised by a Greek family, and this definitely reminds me of my family's cooking. And it's a family owned business, and they're very personable. They always remember us and chat with us when we go there.

gMOiLMUkUyAdQzy1KCyL4w.text: Read a small review in the RJ and liked the idea of family owned and operated.  Decided to try there for dinner and as a bonus found a 15% off coupon on line.  Was not disappointed.  Falafel, gyro, chicken greek salad were all fresh and homemade. As was the humus and yogurt dip for the french fries.  Oh, and the seasoned fries were great too!!  Will definitely return.  Please try it and support the mom & pops in our area.

Z4OPDfyCPO6WfIp4Addw1g.text: This family Greek restaurant is pretty good.  I go for the traditional gyro with a salad.  I have had the seasoned fries and those taste really good as well.  I'm not a big Greek fan but I do crave gyro's and when I do, I always come here.  Price is a little bit higher than I like, I think it was around $9/$10 for the gyro with salad.  Check it out, enjoy!

HeRinrmdT4Ozg3WK8wgkRQ.text: Excellent little Greek cafe hidden in a small strip mall next to Sunset Station. I love their Gyros and tiropita. The service is good and the prices are reasonable. Try the Greek fries with seasoning and feta cheese, wonderful. The portion sizes are fair for the price.

L2Tpwn5q2x7Cfz84hjGXDg.text: Great authentic Greek food. We had the hummus and eggplant appetizers and the gyro salad. All were tasty and the service was good. Priced right with ample portions.

2jAZtofNcNsN8wURvI9GKg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants to come to when I'm in Las Vegas. The staff and owner are friendly, and the food is absolutely wonderful!  I dined there on March 15, 2014 with my two dining companions.  Two of us had souvlaki - he the chicken, me the steak - and both were perfect.  I had a bite of his chicken and it was perfectly marinated and seasoned - ditto with the steak.  Their meat marinade must be a well-kept secret, it is SO good!  Our third diner had the gyros plate, which was equally good.  The salad accompaniment is fresh and perfect to go with the food. The lemon potatoes are a must-have and are fabulous.  All in all, I can find no fault with this lovely little piece of Greece in the middle of a small strip mall.  Incidentally, they are very friendly to their patrons in wheelchairs, of which two arrived while we were there. Hospitality and excellent food abound. You won't be disappointed!

NSGXVw5DgBI3NwisHOAyLA.text: i didnt feel like driving to stephanos since greek bistro is just around the corner to where i live...and i regret it! i think the owner should dine at other greek restaurants to see what they're missing...the GREEK taste!  like i said i regret not driving to stephanos.

MVIOj-d-mvJqSqboOTUL_w.text: DAMNED kick ass food,,,,this is how a GYRO SHOULD TASTE,,yes, I came from chicago and have ate in chicago for the past 33 years and have had my share of gyro meat,,whether it be straight cooked off the spit or fried after the spit but this greek bistro is truly great,,,although a little pricy and the quantity of food isnt compared to the quantity of chicago(fully loaded) it is really great..i would definitely recommend this place to friends and anyone.:)

Iss1wNqGEDXNhQmJzlEtpg.text: I've only been to Greek Bistro for lunch (several times) and have had their salads (good), spanakopita (okay), and gyros (good). The service is good and friendly.   The place is small, in a strip mall, and is not the typical restaurant atmosphere that you would expect when you are having someone wait on you for dinner. With that said, the prices are a little high for lunch and to have to tip on top of that...not for just a good salad. They should go back to more of the casual service environment they used to be where you order at the counter, get your number, and they deliver to your table.   I like them, but I've had better Greek food in Vegas for their prices.

356OQxN_ycvKfegZH19DWw.text: I absolutely love Greek food and this is by far the best I've had in town. Gyro is amazing, both the chicken and the beef! But the absolute winner is their Pasticcio. I have to say it is one of the only dishes in town that I will drive thirty minutes for (about how long it takes for me to get from my apt to the restaurant). The noodles are long and thin, it is well seasoned and there is just enough sauce and ground beef inside; and the top is browned, ahhh I'm salivating just thinking about it. Pasticcio is sometimes called a Greek Lasagna, but I have never had Lasagna this good!! My dad lives around the corner and he was the first person to introduce me to Greek Bistro. My dad is a fantastic chef so my idea of good food has always been a little higher. Before coming to Greek Bistro I had Pasticcio at the Greek Festival held in town every year and was soooo disappointed because I always loved my dad's Pasticcio growing up. But if his was ten times better than their's, Greek Bistro's is ten times better than his. Sorry Dad!! Thank you Greek Bistro for loving my taste buds!

vlF7LQ91lf31zuLMdX7BHA.text: I adore this place, the food is always fresh and delicious, it's well-spiced, but light as well. I've had their salads, gyro, and souvlaki, all excellent. The meat is juicy and well-marinated. Don't leave without a slice of their galactobureko, which is filo with sweet custard. Usually by the time we leave, we're too full to eat dessert so we take some home for later. It's to die for. The service is also excellent. We've only gone in a handful of times, but the server always remembers us and is very friendly. Don't pass up a chance to try this place.

oRMzkcNdIMvi3mOcKPi6ew.text: Been eating here forever and it is always great!  They make the best lamb shank, Pastitsio - Greek Lasagna, and gyro... plus the Greek seasoned fries and super with the white dipping sauce!  Never had a bad meal here and the service is very friendly too!

NyB1qTkO28zbcWBZsCYa8Q.text: This place has good food but the staff/owner are jerks. Not only do they give you a sour face when you use a groupon. We didn't even eat there.  We got our food to go, even left a tip AND they were super reluctant to give me an extra garlic/yogurt sauce. That stuff costs 5 cents at most! Absolutely ridiculous. If you didn't want to honor the groupon deal then why sign up for it? Absolute horse crap. Never again.

fxUVPg1Zuw76WIkVjYQC2A.text: I have been going to Greek Bistro for the last two years, and the food is great. Their fries are tasty too. As of late, the service has been sub par. The last two times we arrived at 7:30 and 8:30, and the owners were rude to us. They kept staring at us while we ate. We felt uncomfortable as they served us or took our requests as they seemed to be in a hurry to close up shop and leave. We left around 8:30 and 9:07 (they close at 9). They also charged us for yogurt sauce they failed to put on the gyro. It is disappointing to go to one of our favorite spots and be treated this way. I will no longer go here and frequent Crazy Pita instead.

VfNTT2_oXZybqVHmlylkKg.text: I eat here with and without the wife at least once a week. The restaurant is owned and operated by a greek family who is always friendly. The food is fantastic and as authentic as can be! The portions are large and filling. I have never had a bad meal and take my out of town guests here all the time. Every time any of them visits me they always ask to come back here!

-D3PJ6Tq6-sBONZ9-CcKPA.text: I tried this place for the first time today. It's in the same shopping center as my work but I had yet to discover it. I ordered the Gyro with salad and a side of hummus via phone which was ready in 5 min. I love this type of food and have had a lot of Gyros around town. The traditional Gyro I had today was excellent. It was so big I couldn't eat the salad that was with it. The hummus was good and I had to share it because it too was a large portion. It came with pita chips and bread which was a treat. Overall, the food was wonderful and I'll make it a point to come back. Thanks for a great lunch! =)

sjkjpsp5OHDHJgB-fPPf-A.text: The prices are a little higher here than at other Greek restaurants, but I'm not complaining.  I've only eaten at the Greek Bistro once, but they served me the best gyro I've ever had.  The fries were terrific.  Normally I don't like fries that much, but the seasoning that they put on them is incredible.  The service was friendly and the food came out fairly quickly.  I'd like to get back sometime soon to try something else on the menu.

AQlc2IflboRga8KRNWffmg.text: Greek bistro is an excellent authentic Greek experience. We had the traditional gyro sandwich, one with salad and one with fries. The meat was extremely tender and delicious (cut from the spit). The pita bread was also soft, doughy and delicious.  The tzatziki sauce on the gyros sandwich was creamy and amazing. I thought the sandwich could have used a few more onions but my wife thought it was perfect. The Greek side salad was awesome (not just an afterthought) and the fries were delicious. The staff was extremely nice. For dessert we ate the Baklava, it was warm flaky, cinnamony and sweet and was possibly the best Baklava I have ever eaten.  The Greek Bistro had a very authentic Greek family feel to it's ambiance and was really a joy to have a meal at. This is our new spot for authentic Greek food.  Highly recommend.

jT2u0sFYxUR6343BziSVnw.text: This place is a hidden little gem in Henderson.  When I lived on this side of town we would go here exclusively for the Gyro's.  The sauce they put on it is amazing.  Also, the fries with the garlic sauce is a favorite of my boyfriends.  This is a mom and pop kind of place and you are served by their family.  As for the other food on the menu....I've never tried any of it.  Whenever we go to another greek place we always talk about the greek bistro and how we wish we lived closer to it.

qo4gcMc4ZhbtaQLTjq5YpA.text: I still love this place...I want to provide an update because the owner is always so friendly. She makes you feel like you are a guest at her home. I want to eat here every other day!

m-p-azeqx_h_npMNsNhWvw.text: The gyro's are super delicious and I would give this restaurant 4 stars but my experience here has always been subpar. I use the deal on groupon for Greek Bistro the last 3 times and the owner gives you a very rude face upon presenting the groupon.   The food is good, but I probably won't go back because of the attitude they display.

wB50g1tXSVesXiYU3A6RWA.text: Like another reviewer, I was intending to go to the other Greek cafe down the street, but found it closed.  Gratefully, I found this little gem!  We had the gyro and fries, soup and the falafel platter.  Everything was delicious and well seasoned.  All items were fresh, (as the owner explained, nothing is frozen), and all items are individually prepared from her personal recipes.  Couldn't be much better, especially with a menu that contained other Greek and Mediterranean specialties such as leg of lamb.  While the servings were ample, the desserts, rice pudding and cheesecake are something to save room for.  The server was a very nice older lady, just like mom.  In fact, the entire experience was like being invited to the owner's house while she prepared delicacies from her kitchen.  Definitely worth a try...I will be back.

p27Ry2z1A0sMjm8StIvTVQ.text: Was headed to my fav spot The Great Greek just up the street when I came across this spot and decided to give it a try and see how it measured up. I ordered the soup and chicken gyro that came with salad or fries. I opt for the salad. The soup was amazing, the gyro although tasty I wasn't a fan of the tzadziki, I felt the chicken was a little on chewy side. The older woman who works here seemed to be more occupied with other patrons and showing them pictures on her phone which left me sitting waiting for my check with an empty glass of water for a good 15-20 mins. For me personally I will stick to my fav spot. This is not a bad alternative and a bit more $.

MYX7jsMM4vxaBrWUNF5wxQ.text: The traditional gyro is awesome!! Both myself and the wife loved it. Mine came with fries. Tasty. My wife got the side salad. Great salad with lots of feta. Super friendly . A definite favorite place for gyros.

5Vt8zIpa1q9Lh0utG8dTrg.text: First time trying this restaurant after seeing all the positive reviews. Had the traditional gyro and it is DELICIOUS!! Meat is very tender and flavorful. Fries had a great seasoning. Will definitely come back again!

HtkFEnr4ZRjfc7DinvIJTw.text: By far the best Greek Restaurant in Las Vegas/Henderson! I live about half an hour away and will gladly drive out for the Gyro's! Traditional or Chicken, you can't go wrong! Always fresh and flavorful, and let me just say their fries (Greek style) are to do for! The seasoning they use is what makes them so good! Family owned and operated and always friendly, they make you feel right at home! Highly recommend!!

UaYclzy9WDKMy-Nup9sgpw.text: UN-BELIEVABLE!!!  It's like fresh out of Mama Greece's kitchen! Service is outstanding; warm & friendly. And the food? I'm not sure there are words in the English language to describe how amazingly delicious this was!!!! Can't wait to come back! :) Thank you!

3D1-BZ4e12sMSWXr_A8GmQ.text: Incredible! Best Greek salad in town! I have been looking for something quality & quick so this place will be my new favorite stop between meetings!

riP06MKNHZzJ-Qu9C6G7pg.text: I love this place. My boyfriend and I go whenever we can. The food is always great and the service is great too. Highly recommend if you like good Greek food!

qfq22dUTog71Bq_t39SW9Q.text: The food is good here but the owner or the lady that runs this place is abrasive and rude. She slammed my credit card on the counter and threw her order booklet down after she took my order and was not pleasant at all! So I asked her "are you ok today cause you're usually really nice?" And she yelled at me saying "what did I do? What did I say to you? I have a headache! I'm not doing anything to you!" So I sat down to wait for my order and she was still going on yelling while I had already walked away! SMH! I'm really disappointed with the service because I come here all the time and I do not wish to come back...

098_yjuvSfWDKRXcgTOHrQ.text: Great Food. We have noticed that most of the people here are repeat customers and the owner takes the time to greet everyone one of them. Will go there again.

6i_JShvAV3nz2DwkS5kD0w.text: This is the most awesome place on the planet. I love the food. I love the owner and her family. I'm here weekly. Can't get enough of her cooking.

-uSJdLDyGWDYvKZcaDLRLA.text: I have been trying to find authentic Greek food in Vegas area. I have been misled by all the "Greek" renounced places that sell only initiations. This is by far the MOST AUTHENTIC Greek food I have seen in the entire valley.  Simply delicious.

yueZ6zz7WydWHzYSA95XaQ.text: Everything my wife and I have tried here has been amazing! When we get a craving for Greek food, Greek Bistro is the place to go. The food and service is always great.

zq2k_eZ8Gyj2AyQK4_ojdw.text: Seriously good Greek food! Been to most of the Greek places in town, and I think this is by far the best. The chicken souvlaki plate, gyros, and falafel are all fantastic!

qIqRUW2Cz-EiqWYilucK3Q.text: Yum!  They don't have a kids menu, but they have a great kids plate with gyro meat or chicken, rice and fries.  Saffron chicken special was amazing! The spanikopita was just delicious.  We will definitely be back!

GoHEBpY86nfILXZB8FAO5g.text: This place is amazing!!! It was so delicious and so filling. I got the traditional gyro with a salad. Perfection! Can't wait to go back.

lyPucRF9HlGbHMagL4HgDw.text: This is one of the best Greek restaurants in town. Gyros are on point, lemon potatoes are a signature item, best spanikopita! Clean hole-in-the-wall with a mom and pop vibe and great service.

2zaf3wJDbnzb2FUkR4V4Iw.text: Best darned Greek food I've ever eaten. I come back here for another gyro every time I return to Vegas. Hopefully they're around forever.

0JxrBQMIb-jWu314iCo94w.text: After reading all the great reviews on Yelp I decided to give it a try especially since I would be shopping at Walmart and Lowe's just a very short distance away. All the positive prior reviews were are absolutely correct. For a smaller establishment the seating is very amble as is the parking. For my first foray I decided to go with the classic gyro with side salad instead of fries. The gryo was so packed with quality meat that it was difficult to do justice to my salad. Next time I'll have them pack the salad to go. After all I needed to save room for dessert... so I decided to order the baklava. Without a doubt world class....5 stars. The Greek Bistro it's going to be one of my favorite local restaurants.

SSXbRsRNfEQ7YLk4NiuoHg.text: Update Time  GB is still a great spot to get your Greek food fix in Henderson.  I've been back for lunch multiple times since the first time I reviewed this place, usually for the chicken gyro and fries.  Today I finally switched it up, trying the avgolemono (egg-lemon) soup after some Yelp friends were talking it up yesterday.  Definitely lemony, this chicken soup with rice was a delightful accompaniment to the chicken salad, another first for me there.  Both are served with soft pieces of pita bread and it made for a delicious meal.  I took half of the salad to go since it's a generous portion and I was already a bit full with the soup.  This family-run business always has great service and I'm never disappointed with a meal there.

Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken salad.
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken gyro.

8n51lXRnlVY0IKu-KA327g.text: Been here a few times food is great and delicious  Staff is friendly  Fresh and super flavourful

bS9FBqyKr2r-TXHVEQGeIA.text: We had a work lunch catered through Greek Bistro today and it was fantastic, I had eaten here one time previously for lunch take out and remember it was good but I wasn't hurrying back. I'm not a super huge fan of Greek food but this was really tasty! I would recommend it to anyone looking for Greek food in the area. We had a little bit of everything...Salad, Gyro meat, Chicken, Pita Bread, Lemon Potatoes, Seasoned French Fries, Falafel, and Rice and all the sauces. The meat and chicken was moist and flavorful. Somehow they are able to keep their fries from getting soggy during transport! The Falafel was a bit dry and may have been a bit over cooked, a little dark on the outside. Everyone loved just about every thing, it was a big hit with us! I will give them another try on my own and hopefully get to use them through work again.

--tPKCbkUDaSaYXBj-rcUQ.text: This place deserves more than 5 stars! I come here all the time and it's literally the food of the Gods! I always either get the filet mignon or the lamb!!! It comes with literally the best tasting rice, salad, and the sauce for the meat is AMAZING! It's always a hit or miss for me but they're doing it right. Their pita bread that comes with the meal is also phenomenal. It's the perfect softness and the bread just melts in your mouth. They have it so perfect here. If you want to try Greek food for the first time, this is THE place to be! The owner of this place is also very sweet! She checks up on everyone often :)

WzRx3FlIqoviTJG2L3Y3zQ.text: Was in Vegas looking for a place to eat and just happened to stop in at the Greek Bistro. I got the traditional gyro and babganush. I never had babaganish so I gave it a try. It was good! The gyro was probably the best gyro I ever had. They didn't skimp on the meat either. It was packed. The food tasted fresh.   The service was excellent. I would highly recommend this place. The price is reasonable for how much food you get.

N8NDxyhC8_-D6u9x3HK4HQ.text: Very nice, friendly service and great food  The price is reasonable and the tzatziki was pretty good. It was my first time here in a couple of years but it was worth the return

TbSkIfqgDBE-u9D-PTbfCQ.text: Wonderful family run greek restaurant. It's a little hard to find but you will be glad you did! They have the best gyros and baklava I have ever had, including from Greece.   The gyros are on super soft pita bread with plenty of taziki  sauce and even an extra side for those of us who love taziki. The meat is delicious, very tender and topped with diced tomato and cucumber. They also have a gyro salad it you are watching your carbs :). It comes with either a greek salad or fries. The fries are seasoned and make a perfect match.   Don't leave without trying the baklava. It is so flaky and full of nuts and honey, absolutely delicious.

zfJMJ7vtpue9JBPh4kF1aA.text: I love this place,the food portions are a nice size,the veggies are fresh and the meat is always so tasty.The staff is so friendly and they always do a great job of getting you in and out quickly when your order is to go.My order has never been incomplete and the menu selection is large but not so large that it is hard to decide what you want.

m8V1ufAKcWM6oX3seb_xyw.text: I was thinking about going to the Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace today but I've been there so many times and I wanted to try something new. So I found the Greek Bistro on Yelp and I came battle hungry haven't ate breakfast or lunch yet. So I ordered the chicken gyro and the grilled beef plate along with some fries. The server was nice and friendly and got my ice tea filled every time it was empty. Now down to the food   Chicken gyro 4/5 the portion was spot on and nice grilled chicken  Greek salad 3/5 it was bland I want more sour and tangy flavor  Grilled Beef plate 4/5 the rice was not bad and the grilled beef was right on  Ice tea 4/5 nice taste and I got my refilled every time  Fries 4/5 nice and crispy and hugh portions   I don't know how is this place surviving because they're zillions of good eateries around that area and when I went around 2PM there were only 2 people and myself.

fpnUrZcsZqlMH-2GUsVrPA.text: Great food and service! Pistachio Greek Lasgna was awesome and my hubby's filet was tender and tasty with lemon potatoes yummy! Can't forget the homemade Greek ice cream and baklava! We live in northwest but worth the trip! We definitely will be back.

fGYF0p7Ui13vNiyWIZ7_HQ.text: Greek Bistro is 100% the best Greek food I have ever had!! The meat is cooked and seasoned amazingly!!! The chef cooks the best, most tender meat, and grilled both the filet mignon and lamb to a perfect medium rare!!The pita bread is so soft and yummy! The hummus came with fresh made pita chips, both also made to perfection!! The restaurant is clean and a great atmosphere. We took the food to go, but the sweet woman that took our order made sure to give us our drinks while we waited and came by the table to check on us while we waited, loved her!! My husband and I will definitely be making this our new favorite Greek place to go!!

LKpR-e9G4osxjb5iY9TSJQ.text: Meat too salty, rice over cooked and over priced--will not be going back!

w3i4MEHQWkNLGtslqfqICg.text: Gyros here are so good! Flavorful and delicious.  I love their Greek fries!!! They add tons of flavors to it- amazing!

csmdLKiOnhzfcFX7dxR70A.text: under new ownership and food is still good.  Gyros are our favorites.  They have redecorated it and looks much better except the chairs need foam on the bottoms.  Their dolmades were good but a little bland - and I would have preferred to have Tzakaki with them instead of the sauce they provided.  Our only complaint is that the waiter had on so much after shave it left a smell around our table that didn't go with the good.  That affected our rating!  Its great for lunch!

a6c41-cfyN6ZUs6cB9Fmjg.text: Food was all very good. You can tell this is a family owned establishment. Very delicious

gHSRMTCr0yoEqv9joPLueA.text: The Greek bistro is by far the best Greek restaurant in Las. Vegas, I have never had a bad meal always fresh

7y3o9L5RIYXuG3RL8CuLMQ.text: Awesome. Full recommendation. Simple menu. Tasty food. Great prices. I have enjoyed lunch and dinner here. Best gyro in Henderson. Customer service is second to none.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb gyro, Greek fries, garlic dip..

hcwuHIb_J4sOWa5xYlJkzg.text: Ask for Raffi! Excellent customer service and knowledge base coupled with impeccable manners. My gyro was perfect! Thank you.

NT7pQQ1V_GeqJh11W6qgyQ.text: My first time but definitely not my last. I had the gyro sandwich and Greek fries. The sandwich had just the right combination of meat, onion, tomato, and sauce. I had never had Greek fries before. They were very good. For dessert I had the baklava which was twice as big and twice as good as any other place.

n7QQfUXR3xDDLkUCXMvFEg.text: Love their gyro sandwich....Lots of meat and tasted delish! Authentic Taste! Price is reasonable... Hope they don't check change the meat portion. And of, the lady greeted us as soon as we walked in. There is nothing much nicer being welcome with a smile.  That  such quality in food places sometimes lacks.

piiK5hWc0VMQm-0F_2fibg.text: Delicious family run Greek restaurant; definitely one of the best in Henderson. I am a big fan of their Gyros and I appreciate the ripe tomatoes, house made sauce, and plentiful Gyro meat. My problem is that I like Gyros so much that it is hard for me to try anything else, Lol. Therefore I cannot review the other items on the menu, but their french fries have a unique seasoning blend that is a nice touch. The server was genuinely friendly and his service was excellent.  The ambiance is nice and I love the wallpaper with views of the Greek Islands. I will be back next time I am in the area and have a Gyro craving!

zHcPBZMF9ZpPGsFdFBZ7Dg.text: Great place to go for a Greek food. Clean and friendly staff. I will go again. Great price too.

ceR3OSeBkVGeVElPgkpfuA.text: Came highly recommended by a friend and we were not disappointed! Had the traditional gyro with fries very flavorful! My sister had the chicken gyro with fries and she loved it. Their fries are bomb dot com!! The staff/owners super friendly and attentive. Oh try their lemonade it was really good and I don't really like lemonade unless it has alcohol. Definitely will be back.

V2a4m7T09yRmazLeQRxrlQ.text: The food and service is really good the place is really clean and very nice environment i give it 5 stars totally recommend it

6q-Rky0ri5haI4FP3ywJwg.text: I love the food here.  Pita is fresh, hummus is homemade, family owned.  People who take pride in what they serve.  If you are looking for atmosphere this place is pretty austere, if it is about the food, this is the place!

lSpeSeK805upH4X-sGx_Gg.text: Delicious food. Efficient service with a smile. Server was happy to produce separate checks for our group. I had the garlic shrimp over rice and spinach with raisins and almonds. Sounds odd but it was great! Greek owners and several Greek customers which is usually a good sign.

uAziHlnH9L6P0uqgyneF4g.text: It's just. not. fair! Why does Henderson, on the other side of Vegas from me, have all the best Greek places? There's Great Greek, and Stephano's, and Yalla, and now I discover you even have Greek Bistro (hard though it was to find). Not fair!  Food here is perfect. They have three salads, several wraps and plates, and a variety of desserts and apps. Despite the casual setting, there is table-service. Love the wall-sized photo of Greece and the blue-and-white decor scheme.  The gyros salad is my favorite purchase, topped with tomatoes, feta, and a ton (perhaps a bit too much, best asked for on the side) of delicious tzatziki sauce, as well as a generous amount of gyros meat. Their gyro wraps are also delightful, with fresh and pillowy pita and a giant portion size. Their fries are spectacular, whether or not you order them Greek style and add feta.   Pricing is fair for the portions (about $10/person) and quality, service is friendly, and basically everything on their menu is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gigantic salad

s_ik6U5SrAWtUlpwfrrfZQ.text: Excellent Greek food! They give you a lot of food plus fries! A coworker of mine recommended this place and it wasn't disappointing! Excellent Greek food!

yweQdyyC_FuV3Ql2fq2JCA.text: Had the beef gyro--it was pretty good and was a large size. Not a fan of the fries. Baklava was possibly the worst I have ever had--tasted very old or burnt.

snaHAWQB0Fw7BvBSDB5UTw.text: Just about 20 minutes after eating here my stomach hurts and I ate it yesterday and I've had stomach problems since YESTERDAY after eating here.  I eat out a lot. I've never had a sensitive tummy. I can eat spicy food. I can eat just about anything and never get an upset tummy so it worries me that since yesterday after eating here I've been in pain.  It has to be something pretty gross to have me feeling this way into the NEXT day?

mN6Tt-TmdHBeuVqzA_R1Xw.text: Greek food usually isn't my thing, but I started to come here for the past 2 years on and off since one of my offices is next door to them.  The food is authentic, and the service is down right homely.  They make you feel like you're apart of the family.  You'll find all the usual suspects like Gyros, Greek chicken salads, lamb, ect.   The filet meal is always my go to... can't go wrong for $15.

UuJYk0Qtl7kE4yyiybiAbw.text: POOR POOR POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.   Seriously. Their credit card machine was broken and they failed to tell me that before I ordered my food (waiting patiently for it to be prepared). When it was time to pay, I was unable to due to their faulty machinery. The girl at the front asked me to give her multiple cards, none of which worked (I didn't have cash on me).  After I had been standing there for 20 minutes waiting for this girl to try and figure out the machine, the owner walked over, wondering what was taking so long. They tried again and were unable to fix it.   Then, the owner had the nerve to ask me if I wanted to drive across the street to go to the ATM. ABSOLUTELY NOT! I obviously have other things to do since I ordered my food to-go. And after making me wait 25 minutes due to your screw up, comping me an $8 gyro doesn't seem like that great of a loss (especially since it was probably gonna get thrown out anyway).   Never coming back. They don't deserve my business.

XfxcJa1HGkSWIFjSGWt5WA.text: Freaking fantastic. I loved, loved the greek french fries. The best fries outside of Canada. (And if you have never eaten in Canada you need to go and try any restaurant there.)  A young man helped me out, should have asked his name. He was very polite and brought me water after I told him no thank you. I did appreciate his thoughtfulness after the fact.  Sorry for not taking a picture. The food looked and tasted so delish I just started eating. ;)  Honestly I wish more restaurants served crispy non greasy fried food. I have no idea how they made everything on my plate taste so good, just happy they did.  If you haven't been here yet you need to go, it's worth the trip.

WdkTQiC5br4pnlAEwgmKvQ.text: Gluten Free? I get the feta fries, the rice bowl with chicken, and their yummy rice pudding. I eat here at least 1-2 a week. Love it.

LQCM_zUJGo_mD8GOjTWPGA.text: Is it acceptable for employees to be on their phone while waiting on you? Not in my book.    We walked in one afternoon to an empty dining area.  The guy was on the phone and didn't hang up before walking over to our table.  This also happened when I went up to pay our bill.  I just don't understand taking a personal call while a customer is standing in front of you.  Very unprofessional.    I will say I liked the gyro with fries.  It was packed with a lot of meat and toppings.  We really could have split it easily.  Unfortunately that is where my enjoyment ended.  My husband and I both did not feel well shortly after our meal.  I can't necessarily point fingers and blame the restaurant.  I certainly can say I wont rush back to test it again.

2S9iKEE0Rup1n8zaneJCUw.text: Great little Greek spot!! We ordered the babaganoush, pastichio, gyro plate and the galaktobouriko for dessert! All of it was very good and the staff was very friendly!! We'll definitely be back!

NnjwtBb5lqVPdAYeB288Rg.text: I'm on a roll with Greek Restaurants lately!   Great service: Staff Is super nice and attentive.   Restaurant: Clean and comfortable.  Patrons can watch the staff prepare their food.  Food: The side salad was great. It had lettuce, onions, cucumbers, olives, feta cheese, and the right amount of dressing (It wasn't drowned).  I would come back just to get the lemon potatos. Red potatos perfectly seasoned with a hint of lemon. Very good!   Great restaurant and I highly recommend stopping by for a meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro plate with lemon potatos.
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. Side salad was delicious!

yPeZxxwn51x4u5zYFAv1fw.text: I stopped in to pick up some lunch and am glad I did. When I walked in they had a good amount of customers and I was greeted right away by a nice man. I told him I wanted to place a order to-go and he handed me a menu and said I could sit down and take my time going over the menu. After placing my order, I was told it would be 10-15 minutes because it was being made fresh. I didn't have to pay until my order was ready and the man helping me was very courteous, welcoming and inside was clean.   Chicken Salad ($10.75) - Chicken, lettuce, cucumber, tomato, onion, olives, feta cheese and dressing. The salad was a good portion and the lettuce was very fresh and crisp. I was impressed with the amount of chicken and it tasted so good! I could just eat that chicken alone it had such great flavor. There was 3 pieces of tomato and 2 cucumber slices which was a bummer, I'd have liked more veggies. The menu said the pita bread would be warm, but the pieces were cold. I'm a huge fan of the salad over at The Great Greek (just down the street at Marks and Warm Springs) because of the amount of veggies they put in it and they also include grilled pita bread which I prefer to the cold. While I really liked the version here at Greek Bistro and was full and satisfied, I feel TGG has them beat in that department. I did ask for a side of tzatziki sauce and it wasted very good!   Baklava ($4.25) - Delicious! The piece was huge, sweet and the perfect dessert! When I first saw it, I thought it might be too sweet. It wasn't too sweet at all and the top part was lightly crisp and the bottom was gooey good. Try this!  Since I liked the chicken and tzatziki sauce so much I can see my regular being a chicken gyro here and will give it a try on my next visit. They make your order fresh, so calling ahead can cut down your wait time some. Catering is also available.

photos.caption: Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Baklava&#34; @ Greek Bistro - 2/8/16
Photo of Greek Bistro - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Chicken Salad&#34; @ Greek Bistro - 2/8/16

4uVWwdyG3kDbLGhlO8KxQQ.text: Saw this place on Yelp when I was in Henderson and figured I would give it a try for lunch.  It was located in a stripmall and was a little ...old looking.  I went in and the place was clean and the staff was really friendly.  I figured I would just try the plain gyro with a salad instead of fries, when it came out I was pretty surprised how big o a portion it was.  Everything about it was great, the gyro was one of the best I have had and the side salad was worht getting on its own.

Ypt_m7SevuuoZPY9_-OhUw.text: Love this place. The food is amazing and the owners are truly wonderful people. As long as they are there we won't go anywhere else!!!!

1PyRbxcuEs13nNf68ujS-Q.text: Yum, chicken gyro "sandwich" with greek salad. I don't know what they put on that salad but it's so yummy, I'm not even tempted by the fries it's that good! Wonder if they'll do extra salad instead of the pita, will find out and if they do they're getting 5 stars! Chicken is delicious, not dry one bit, seasoning is on point! Decor could use a little help but that's about it.

O-JlleWFdFDQyCH86ZYnPg.text: We stumbled upon this quaint, family owned restaurant during our short stay in Henderson, NV. My husband and I are foodies and health nuts who avoid chains at all cost. This place is a hidden gem that gives an appetizing taste of both Greek culture and flavor. We decided it was definitely one we would re-visit if we lived nearby.  The service was fast and friendly. Gyro Salad was huge and topped with a mound of very flavorful meat. Ask for tzatziki sauce on the side because they give you a large portion. Warm pita bread was also a delicious compliment to the meal...very good with the tzatziki sauce or hummus dip.

Hxy3mV0zA-KlQzBnLkFHOg.text: Chicken gyro and fries I love it. Great spot for lunch or dinner. Nice people good service. Eat in or call in for pick on the way home. Either way try it out. Yum

6H2w5FlbY4-o9hFuSFUTVg.text: Food was amazing.  BF loves gyros, and these were THE BEST.  Normally, I'm not a fan, as they tend to be too salty and/or dry for my taste, but the gyros here were juicy and perfectly seasoned.  I had the falafel, which were nicely-fried globes of goodness (would have preferred tzatziki sauce to the tahini that was included, but that's just my preference.)  The rice pudding was FABULOUS - I would like to have vats of it shipped to my home in San Diego, thank you very much.  Very small dining room, packed on a Sat. at lunch time.  Nice counter guy comped me an iced tea because I had to stand to wait for my to-go order.

_hV-i7CMnXaMAMiYdE_UdQ.text: A gyro craving hit me today, so I went on a mission. Greek Bistro was the second place we hit, after the first didn't pan out.  The restaurant is very cute. All sorts of kitschy "Greek" stuff, with lots of blue and murals. You can tell its family-owned, which can be good and not so good. I almost felt like an intruder. The waitress/cashier was not too personable (adjusting the chairs we had just stood up from and pushed in, etc).  We got two traditional gyros to go. $8.99 for each combo (gyro and fries), slightly on the high side, but definitely not outrageous. The gyros were big and so good! The meat was perfectly cooked, the tzatziki was good and the veggies weren't mush. The portion of fries was huge and covered in Greek seasoning. Not the greatest, but in line with fries I've had at other gyro places.  Craving - satiated!

uyXbS4ZxlLfsw_PWNKbM0Q.text: Great food probably the best Gyro in Henderson.  Comes with fries or a Greek salad, both sides are good.  I have tried the skewers and they are also awesome.  Consistent food quality / quantity, I have never been disappointed and I have been a customer for years.  I Love the wall murals, I've been to Santorini and there is no place on earth like it.

bBJnviYxASrOl5N_G4nxaQ.text: We looked for a restaurant that was within walking distance of our hotel.  We were very pleased to have found The Greek Bistro. The gyros plate was excellent and the service was prompt and personable.  Many people seemed to be regulars and there was a high volume of take-out, as well.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

W6MT5bKNVSLyYNI1NVKbVw.text: Found this gem a few years ago and every year we visit we come back here to eat! The gyro meat is from the spot, the tzatziki is spot on and the keftedakia is perfectly done. Definitely worth checking out!

9CtRCSIdepckRKloJw61xw.text: The best tazatiki sauce in town. I love the small, family atmosphere and they almost always have a game on! The traditional gyro is amazing and flavorful and delightfully sinful at the same time. The Greek fries are full of garlic-y goodness and guaranteed to repel any stalkers waiting for you in the parking lot. A friend had the Greek lasagna lol it tasted a lot better than it looked.  No need to say I'll be back...I'm a regular!

-G9iyxS0GxVU0J9Xu1WiWg.text: Fantastic restaurant. Side salads nothing short of delectable. Gyro and kabob were incredibly flavorful. Fun environment, pleasant servers, overall a wonderful experience. Would definitely recommend.

EbxDb0vQ6EaN0AnySCHDiw.text: Probably the best Greek spot I have ever had hands down and the family that owns it is the nicest ever. Gyros and spanakopita is a must and they're baklava omg!!!

cwthR6TpP7M251NqbnvclA.text: Love the gyros here. The lamb is cooked perfectly. Everything is fresh. The fries are uniquely seasoned and I eat too many every time! There's a great pastry dessert with fruit, goes really well with their strong Turkish coffee. Got 2 platters of baklava for a party once and it was a big hit.

5d85g2JDSNa7z5DuZ4muyg.text: Some of the best Greek food I've had in Las Vegas so far!! I really enjoy the small atmosphere and the staff is like very friendly!

Dq1Ojl8PYPUsGMLlMqAkHQ.text: I went here a few years ago but a lot came in between, so I am just getting back to this restaurant. To my delight, the food is as luscious as ever. I grew up in a city that has a lot of excellent Greek restaurants (Boston, Mass.)  so I know good from great .This one is great. I am a vegetarian, so I had the falafel wrap with its generous salad and the baba ganoush. WOW! Taste sensation! I intend to try the egg lemon soup next time and if I remember from the past the Spanakopita is outstanding. Can't wait. (Just have to stagger my visits. I want to go back every day, lol.)

oBzm6u0XjXiPd9Qc9rvfAQ.text: My all time fav and new weekly craving is the chicken gyro with fries. Best fries in THE world! When I'm in the mood for salad I go with the chicken gyro salad. Been to other Greek places but never as good as Greek Bistro!

BP3MHVyw2ShuZviBLQRmxg.text: My daughter and I have been here twice. You get a gyros and a lot of fries for 9 bucks. The gyros are excellent and we love the seasoning on the Greek fries. The service is always fast and courteous. Parking kind of sucks if you want to be right in front but there's tons in the adjacent Sunset Station lot. I really like this place. It's worth a visit. And the waiter was very handsome to boot. (My 14 year old categorized him as "the hot Greek waiter...high praise).

cXZHeRtQmWe2GeUFB3vL7Q.text: As of today, this is still the best Greek / Mediterranean food I have tasted in Clark County, although I admit I haven't been to too many such establishments. It's a tiny, quaint little place with some fitting ethnic decorations on the walls and Greek colors over the tables.  The first thing you'll notice about this joint is that it is very much a mom and pop establishment. The food is VERY home cooked and you'll taste it right away. The owner is a Greek lady who is generally a very nice host--but she may fuss a bit over Groupons-- just a warning. You'll also be pleased to find that the servings are quite generous. The wraps are all very filling and come with a heap of delicious seasoned fries. I barely finished the platter when I ordered it for dinner recently.  The greek salad is mouthwateringly delicious and she sure doesn't skimp on it.   As for the gyros, arguably the staple of any place with "Greek" in the title, they are the best I have ever tasted. Seriously. You'll immediately notice a difference in the meat that she uses, as well as the authentic Tzatziki sauce that she puts in them. If you order gyros around town at casual fast food places, you'll very easily notice the superior quality of this one. I've also had the Kefka (kabob) and the chicken wraps which were both quite pleasing.   You usually spend about 12-14 dollars per person here, and I hope that doesn't discourage some of you cheaper yelpers out there. Sure, you could probably go get another gyro for half the price within a few miles but the extra few dollars are well worth it for by the superior quality of the food. There is a little bit of a wait, but take satisfaction knowing that it's time spent cooking and preparing your meal freshly.

FIJcQNZsXG_qBwM8d_lYpQ.text: I have passed this place many times and decided a few days ago to stop in. I placed an order to go and it didn't take long. The lady at the counter was very nice. When I told her it was my first time in she suggested their most popular items.  I chose the chicken gyro. It was delicious. I wish I had stopped in sooner. The sauce was tasty. I even locked the left over sauce from the wrapper. Yeah it was that good. Will definitely go back again.

iEIiiBNaIbaB2YitC5cs_g.text: Definitely will be going here if I'm craving Greek food. Most Greek restaurants by me have food that is either salty or not very fresh. So either the meat wasn't really good so they over season, and they order too much vegetables. Luckily this wasn't the case at Greek Bistro.    I ordered a Gyro plate and my husband ordered a Gyro sandwich. So tasty! Impressed with the salad, and the rice was cooked to perfection. We both left waddling out of there.     Finding this place is a little hard and when you do, you end up driving around a bit to find parking. Don't worry it's worth finding. Can't wait to try the rest of their menu in the future.

6ywKC2-eilT4UpkNuC9WrA.text: I'm originally from Chicago which happens to be the center of Greek food in the U.S.   There are many small fast food places around Chicago where you can get good Gyros sandwiches. I had them once or twice a week- so long story short- I know gyros.  Having a craving for gyros in Vegas is hard. You just can't find it GOOD out here. So after reading the reviews I decided to give Greek Bistro a try.  I ordered the gyros sandwich and Greek fries combo. At $8.99 without a drink it is quite pricey, but I also realize that all the gyros is shipped in from Chicago- nobody makes it in the west, so cost will obviously be more.  The sandwich was not exactly what you would get back east. First was the sauce. Now you are supposed to get "Tzadziki" sauce which is a thick yogurt based cucumber sauce that is very light and tasty. I don't know what my gyros was drowning in, but my best guess is some sort of modified ranch dressing. It was a thin runny sour flavored ranch dressing. I took the sandwich out of the tray and the stuff ran out all over.  The gyros meat itself was OK but not nearly as much on the sandwich as you would hope for $9. Also on the sandwich was a few leaves of romaine lettuce ad literally 3-4 strands of onion. Chicago style is loaded with onions.  Also, the gyros slices were very uniform. This tells me they don't carve it from their own spit and probably buy it pre sliced. The texture and taste of gyros right off the spit is far superior.  My only other gripe was I originally wanted to eat in, but after seeing the flimsy looking blue plastic chairs in the dining area (I'm a big guy) I decided to be safe and just take the stuff home.  OK, I have to give them at least one good note. I really liked the "Greek fries" Good tasting fries tossed in a spice mixture.  Sorry, but I probably won't be going there again.

tHa5YB1QQTkJsN-FR-K64A.text: Tried this on our way to Costco...My gyro salad was tasty but for the pool of grease on the plate...hubby enjoyed his gyro...neither of us cared for the tzaziki....we much prefer Yanni's!

gHmJz9UE5OFxndBIJdh4nw.text: Went here after Golf and oh boy they make a really good Gyro. Pita was one of the best I ever had. Pita was so good I got them to make me a couple to take home.

VL8si7GciC5CqgTF-xg-Bg.text: Great food every time! They will even make us a vegetarian gyro, which is not on the menu. A friendly, family-owned restaurant!

13-rkItZupXFedKV7TPHjQ.text: Great Greek place right by Sunset Station and across the street from the Galleria. This is also not far from my work. I love the service, the decor, the ambiance and the food in this little slice of Greece! From the first moment of walking in, you can tell this is a small, family owned GREEK restaurant. The decor is tastefully done in all blue and white (Greek flag colors), the blue is especially nice and calming.  You can also see pictures of the owner's family and Greece all around. You can take to go or dine in, your choice. Either way, the service is thoughtful, quick and efficient. My co-worker was there fore the first time and never had Greek food before. The servers all spoke English and explained pretty much every single dish very effectively. Very impressive for an ethnic restaurant especially.  I like their vegetarian menu. Veggie Alexander and salads are excellent. I have yet to hear someone complain about their gyros. Nothing is microwaved here, but cooked right in front of your eyes. The ingredients look and taste very fresh.   This is one little Greek place, unassuming and unboastfull, but serves good, quality food in little time.  One little quip, they discontinued their veggie gyro, which was excellent and my favorite thing on the menu...oh well..this place is still great and highly recommended by me.

AmG-1e0Qc2a9eVig_Xigeg.text: Tiny little bistro, so it's not fast food, but it's good and the prices are right.  Quite possibly one of the best Greek salads I've ever had. Atmosphere is fun; family owned and operated and this place is bustling at 2 pm! Definitely worth a try.

KHaZkDng6QuESYG3HyMgiA.text: Absolutely love the traditional gyro here. Personal favorite in all Vegas! As a recovering carnivore, this place always tempts me into relapsing. Been coming for a couple years, never had a bad experience.

G7HEp0wkofln6au0ISY5_g.text: My wife ordered the chicken souvlaki plate while I requested the gyro plate.  Each entree included warm pita, a salad, rice pilaf and tzadsiki.  The chicken breast was juicy and my gyro meat was both ample and moist, but the side salad and pilaf were disappointing.  I tendered a 2/1 coupon from the Entertainment book, but we were told they stopped accepting the coupons in February, but would accept ours.

UBhSVWnmm8AV7M7DToqscA.text: I'd give Greek Bistro 3.5 stars. The koobideh was tender, juicy and tasty. I'd definitely go back just for that. The gyro/gyro plate were both average.   It's a nice addition to the restaurants in Henderson. There aren't enough family run spots and this is one I'd recommend to people looking for some good koobideh.

i2UqE35wW0S2F5OEFDKgrg.text: Having eaten greek food for years from average restaurants to fine dining, the food you get here for the price is really good and well worth it. Very chill place to kick back and eat some nice greek food.

OjMN3GnJyCSXDwOcxohlcA.text: We enjoyed coming into this place. My bride picked this night and I was happy that it wasn't her usual Outback. It is definitely a small family run business. We were seated and our waitress came over. She was available to answer my questions and our orders were taken. We enjoyed a appetizer of falafel. Never having tried it before, it was crispy on the outside like a hush puppy and warm flavorful on the inside. Thought it was pretty good. It was served with slices of tomato. We both ordered gyro's. My better 9/10's had the chicken and I had the original. They both came with a huge amount of herb covered fries. Almost too much! The fries were really good and hot. We each enjoyed the gyro's. It had great flavor and was packed full with meat and vegetables. The greek sauce is wonderful. Great flavors all around! When we were almost done we talked with the "mom" of this place and she was delightful. She gladly answered our questions and inquired about our meal. Very pleasant. We will come back to this place because the food is legit and the "mom & pop" feel of the place is great.

JZJ2wYm35Gog3lu7EiguyA.text: Some of the best Greek I've had in the US. Definitely the best I've had for the price. We had the traditional Gyro and Baba Ganoush. Staff was very friendly and it was kid friendly. We had our 8 month old with us and several others had kids too.

4QckhF-kMcUHNOyC43-Xlg.text: The food may be a little pricey, but it is good to keep me coming back. I come to this place regularly. Love the seasoning they have on the fries. The flavoring on the gyro is good too.  Napoleon dessert fits my taste. It's not too sweet, light and enjoyable.

rF-8JDSfygPq6PI0lSrMEw.text: Can't say enough about this place! My grandparents live in Vegas and I'm in town visiting from Chicago. Any other foodies know that Chicago is one of the best chow-towns in the country. However, the food at Greek Bistro rivals the best restaurants in Greektown back home.  Not only is the food EXTRAORDINARY, the decor is so cute and festive. The place is outstandingly clean, comfy and welcoming.   The restaurant is owned by an Albanian family that makes the dining experience as wonderful as their dishes. This is what "ma & pa" shops are all about: authentic food, great service and reasonable prices.  Run, don't walk, to this gem!

m58gAUaU4XhQGADCMs1vNQ.text: So I've had some more greek restaurant experiences, and this place's gyros and tzadziki can't be beat! Not to mention we never have to ask for anything, our service is always perfect.

bUwy4EvLZsdc2dqUJa1t2g.text: So the first good Greek food experience I had in Vegas was actually at The Fat Greek off of Decatur. This place BEATS that hands down!!!   It's a small hole in the wall, mom & pop type of place. It has really basic decor (yet a flat screen TV), but plenty of seating and exceptional food. I mean, wouldn't you rather go to a place that isn't visually extraordinary, but has amazing food?  The service was great. They were very nice and accommodating. There were only two servers, one of which I believe was the owner (the 'mom' part of mom & pop), but kept up with the demand of 6 or 7 tables of people.  My mom and I ordered an appetizer of lebneh, which I am SO happy they had, and dolmas (stuffed grape leaves). The lebneh is a kind of strained yogurt, just slightly thinner in consistency than cream cheese and is reminiscent of sour cream. It came out with warm, fresh pita, which is some of the best I've had. It was nice and soft with a wonderful flavor you would expect from fresh bread.  For the main course we both ordered gyros. I mean, you have to order gyros your first time at any Greek place right? She ordered the traditional lamb/beef gyro with a side Greek salad and I ordered a chicken gyro, since I don't eat red meat, with fries. My mom's not very good at description, but told me that her gyro was one of the best she's had...and that's saying a lot seeing as she's been around for awhile - haha. The salad was a basic Greek, but had tons of flavor and the Greek dressing was tasty.  The chicken gyro was DELICIOUS! The chicken was sliced very thin, like you would expect from a traditional gyro, which I appreciated. (When I've ordered a chicken gyro elsewhere they tend to serve it kebob style, which doesn't make for easy eating.) It was very tender and juicy with good seasoning. It was served on that warm, fresh pita with lettuce, tomato, thinly sliced red onion, and gyro sauce. The only bad thing I can say is that they put  A LOT of onion on the gyro...so watch out who you engage in close face to face conversation with later in the day. Mine was served with a side of french fries with a Greek seasoning sprinkled on top...they were SO good. They were nice and hot with the crunchy outside and very soft middle. I couldn't stop eating them, despite my fullness. My mouth kept telling me "one more" while my stomach was telling me "please make it stop." Yet, I couldn't stop...especially when those hot tasty fries were dipped in tzatziki. Speaking of, their tzatziki was really good too. It had good flavor and was a nice consistency. It's hard to make a tzatziki that isn't bland and watery, but they accomplished it well.  The pricing is fair too, especially for the amount of food you get. I think we spent a grand total of 30 something dollars for two appetizers and two entrees.  The only thing I really wish they had was an appetizer sampler. They had so many good appetizers (hummus, labneh, dolmas, etc) and I wanted to try them all...but alas...I couldn't. A sampler would be perfect for anybody wanting to try a little bit of everything, but still have enough room to order an entree!! (hint, hint)  I absolutely love this place, and despite the fact that it's hella far from my house, I will definitely frequent here again...and again.

LQNaLblY9WncDL67lx1PIg.text: This is a cute mom amd pop type place. Gyros meat is juicy and the fries are great tasting. This is my favorite place when i'm on this side of town.

02ZsuipEzPrRvnUcezM_4Q.text: We just love this place and we're so glad they've stayed in business.  It's family run, and everyone that works there is so nice.  The food is great and there's really nothing quite like it in Henderson.  We drive out from Boulder City to eat there sometimes.

2uCo8OCW2zIj09jd31HkYA.text: If you enjoy great food, then this restaurant is perfect! Everything about it is very Greek.  The staff is Greek - the tzatziki sauce, the baklava, the atmosphere - it's all bursting with Greek and that is why it's our number one Greek place!!

w-cm3G7WeFuMpeeJ7GRZqw.text: yes, it's the best greek food in town, but the addition of the server (instead of perfectly acceptable counter service) has turned us off to this otherwise very good restaurant.  I was also disappointed that they refuse to honor their entertainment coupon published in entertainment 2009.  No explanation, just that they apparently decided not to honor it.  Despite the food being good, these issues mean we won't be back.
